consuetio: <entryFree id="n10672" type="main" key="consu^e_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭētĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consuesco, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n10672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">carnal intercourse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clandestina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=61:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 61, 4</bibl> Müll.; Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consuetudinarius: <entryFree id="n10673" type="main" key="consu^e_tu_di^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭētūdĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consuetudo</etym>, <sense id="n10673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">customary, ordinary, usual</hi> (late Lat.): portitor. <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. Dei. 6, p. 219 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭētū-dĭnārĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the usual manner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
consuetudo: <entryFree id="n10674" type="main" key="consu^e_tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭētūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consuesco</etym>. <sense id="n10674.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A being accustomed, custom, habit, use, usage</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10674.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very freq. in all periods, esp. in prose): <cit><quote lang="la">exercitatio ex quā consuetudo gignitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicunt ... consuetudine quasi alteram naturam effici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:25:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 25, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad parentium consuetudinem moremque deducimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 32, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:38:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 38, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:21:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 21, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siculorum ceterorumque Graecorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 45</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum dierum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est meae consuetudinis rationem reddere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: con <pb n="441" /> <cb n="CONS" /> suetudo mea fert, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:29:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 29, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinem tenere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ad nostram consuetudinem sunt levia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra morem consuetudinemque civilem aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod apud Germanos ea consuetudo esset, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cottidianae vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem ex consuetudine vitae sermonisque nostri interpretemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:11:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 11, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">communis sensūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam in proverbii consuetudinem venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 15, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 26, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">otii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:11 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 11 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:76:section=176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 76, § 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendidior loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 20, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:12" default="NO">11, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 13, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">docendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immanis ac barbara hominum immolandorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 10, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">classium certis diebus audiendarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:21 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 21 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indocta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:161" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 161</bibl></cit>: mala, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">assidua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:19" default="NO">12, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 13, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 248</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene facere jam ex consuetudine in naturam vortit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae in consuetudine probantur,</quote> <trans><tr>generally</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 24, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negant umquam solam hanc alitem (aquilam) fulmine exanimatam. Ideo armigeram Jovis consuetudo judicavit,</quote> <trans><tr>the general opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 4, § 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10674.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi>, ex consuetudine, pro consuetudine, and <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>. consuetudine, <hi rend="ital">according to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from custom, by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from habit, in a usual</hi> or <hi rend="ital">customary manner</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Germani celeriter ex consuetudine suā phalange factā impetus gladiorum exceperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 71:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 71, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:85:9" default="NO" valid="yes">85, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:42 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 42 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro meā consuetudine,</quote> <trans><tr>according to my custom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudine suā Caesar sex legiones expeditas ducebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudine animus rursus te huc inducet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc cum se consuetudine reclinaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 24, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:25 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 25 al.</bibl>—Less freq.: praeter consuetudinem, <hi rend="ital">contrary to experience, unexpectedly</hi> (opp. praeter naturam), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 28, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures praeter consuetudinem armatos apparere,</quote> <trans><tr>contrary to custom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 12, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10674.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n10674.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Customary right, usage as a common law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(jus) constat ex his partibus: naturā, lege, consuetudine, judicato ... consuetudine jus est id, quod sine lege aeque ac si legitimum sit, usitatum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 13, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:162" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudine jus esse putatur id, quod voluntate omnium sine lege vetustas comprobavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 67</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 601</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 3, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10674.5" n="2" level="3"> In gram. (instead of consuetudo loquendi; cf. supra), <hi rend="ital">a usage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">idiom of language</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. in 8th" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. in 8th</bibl> and 9th books on almost every page; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:47:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 47, 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:16" default="NO">1, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:2" default="NO">2, 5, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10674.6" n="3" level="3"> In Col. for <hi rend="ital">language</hi> in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudini Latinae oeconomicum Xenophontis tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">7: nostra (opp. Graeca),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10674.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Social intercourse, companionship, familiarity, conversation</hi> (freq. and class; in an honorable sense most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10674.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Deiotarus) cum hominibus nostris consuetudines, amicitias, res rationesque jungebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; so in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">victūs cum multis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 8, 21</bibl></cit>; and in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">victūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domesticus usus et consuetudo est alicui cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 23, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudine conjuncti inter nos sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudine ac familiaritate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with familiaritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare se in consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 28, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insinuare in alicujus consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">immergere se in consuetudinem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistularum,</quote> <trans><tr>epistolary correspondence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutrimentorum,</quote> <trans><tr>community</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10674.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">intercourse in love</hi>, in an honorable, and more freq. in a dishonorable sense, <hi rend="ital">a love affair, an amour, love intrique, illicit intercourse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 28</bibl>; <cb n="CONS" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 9, 6</bibl> and 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:10 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 10 al.</bibl>— <cit><quote lang="la">So also freq.: consuetudo stupri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consuetus: <entryFree id="n10675" type="main" key="consu^e_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. consuesco <sense id="n10675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consul: <entryFree id="n10676" type="main" key="consul"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consul</orth> (in the oldest inscrr. CONSOL, COSOL; abbrev. COS., also in <number>plur.</number> COSS., not before the time of the emperors), <itype>ŭlis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prob. from root sal- of salio; Sanscr. sar-, go; hence also exsul, praesul, v. Corss. Ausspr. II. p. 71</etym>, <sense id="n10676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a consul</hi>, one of the two highest magistrates of the Roman state, chosen annually, after the expulsion of the kings; cf. concerning his election, administration, duties, etc., Dict. Antiq., and the authors there cited (freq. in all periods and species of composition): qui recte consulat, consul cluat, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=80" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 80</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 44, § 136</bibl>: consul ordinarius, <hi rend="ital">one who entered on his office at the regular time</hi>, viz. <hi rend="ital">on the first of January;</hi> opp. consul suffectus, <hi rend="ital">one chosen in the course of the year in the place of one who had died</hi>, or, after the time of the emperors, as a mere honorary title; v. ordinarius and sufficio: consul designatus, <hi rend="ital">consul elect</hi> (so called in the interval between election, at the beginning of August, and entrance on his duties, on the 1st of January), v. designo: consul major, <hi rend="ital">one who had the largest number of votes</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">with whom the Fasces were</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">one who was oldest</hi> (acc. to Nieb., orig. he who was of noble origin); cf. Fest. s. v. majorem consulem, p. 161, 31 Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">after the Lex Julia,</quote> <trans><tr>who had most children</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:15:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem creare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 268</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sufficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:38:82 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 38, 82 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declarare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:2:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 2, 4 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:1:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 1, 1 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem consulem designare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse pro consule,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:91:section=212 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 91, § 212 al.</bibl></cit> In reference to the expression bis, iterum, ter, quater, etc.; tertio or tertium, etc, consul, v. the words bis, iterum, etc., and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1, 3</bibl> and 6.—</sense><sense id="n10676.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n10676.2" n="1" level="3"> In <case>abl.</case> with the names of the consuls (in the poets usu. of one consul), <hi rend="ital">for the designation of the year</hi>: Orgetorix M. Messalá M. Pisone Coss., regni cupiditate inductus, etc., <hi rend="ital">in the consulship of</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">in the year of Rome</hi> 693), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2</bibl>: is dies erat a. d. V. Kal. Apr. L. Pisone A. Gabinio Coss. (i. e. <hi rend="ital">the 27th of March</hi>, 696 <hi rend="ital">of the city</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam venit Mario consule et Catulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:43:161 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 43, 161 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphora fumum bibere instituta Consule Tullo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 14, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:6 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 13, 6 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Bibuli consulis amphora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 28, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphora centeno consule facta minor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a hundred years old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:45:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 45, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10676.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, as collective term for the magistracy, <hi rend="ital">the consuls</hi>, when the office is in view rather than the persons: quod populus in se jus dederit, eo consulem usurum; <cit><quote lang="la">non ipsos (sc. consules) libidinem ac licentiam suam pro lege habituros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">legatisque ad consulem missis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 52, 6</bibl></cit> Heerw. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter sine populi jussu nullius earum rerum consuli jus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 29, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10676.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10676.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A proconsul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 33, 4</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; cf. id. § 7; 31, 49, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato, 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 6:3:2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 6, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:14:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 3, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10676.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The highest magistrate</hi> in other states: <cit><quote lang="la">consul Tusculanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 44, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">BARCINONENSIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 4, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">COLONLAE ASTIGITANAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 351, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Clar. Urb. 14, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10676.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An epithet of Jupiter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Firm. 3</bibl>; App. de Mundo, c. 25.—* </sense><sense id="n10676.8" n="D" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">est animus tibi ... consul non unius anni,</quote> <trans><tr>continually fulfilling the duties of the highest magistracy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 39</bibl></cit> Orell. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
consularis: <entryFree id="n10677" type="main" key="consu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consul</etym>, <sense id="n10677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a consul, consular</hi> (very freq.): aetas, <hi rend="ital">the age required by law for the consular office</hi>, viz. the 43d year, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 48</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">annus, II.: comitia,</quote> <trans><tr>for the choice of consul</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:26:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 26, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 16, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lictor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:58:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 58, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25:16" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 25, 16</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:68" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 68</bibl></cit>: femina, <cb n="CONS" /> <hi rend="ital">of a consul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 69</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 9, 1</bibl> res, <hi rend="ital">worthy of a consul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 8, 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ortio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; and cf. <itype>infra</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>named after the consul during whose administration it was made</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:79" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 79</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp.: homo consularis,</quote> <trans><tr>a man of consular rank, one who has been consul</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:47:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 47, § 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 79, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 27</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vir consularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 21, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 2, 3</bibl>.—And, </sense><sense id="n10677.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭlāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n10677.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One who has been consul, an ex-consul</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">one of consular rank</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregios consules habemus, sed turpissimos consulares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 53, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 12, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10677.3" n="B" level="2"> In the time of the empire, <hi rend="ital">a legate sent by the emperor as governor into a province</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 8</bibl> and 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">63 al.</bibl>—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">consularis adoptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>. prooem. § 13 Spald.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭlārĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a manner worthy of a consul</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulariter acta vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 10, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consularitas: <entryFree id="n10678" type="main" key="consu^la_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭlārĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consularis, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n10678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dignity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">office of consul</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imperial governor</hi> (late Lat.), Cod. Th. 6, 19, 1; 6, 27, 10; 9, 26, 4 al.</sense></entryFree>
consulariter: <entryFree id="n10679" type="main" key="consu^la_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭlārĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consularis <sense id="n10679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consularius: <entryFree id="n10680" type="main" key="consu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = consularis (late Lat.): dignitas, Jul. Epit. c. 98, § 359.</entryFree>
consulatus: <entryFree id="n10681" type="main" key="consu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>consul</etym>, <sense id="n10681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of consul, the consulate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consulship</hi> (very frq. in all periods): <cit><quote lang="la">honorum populi finis est consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus ille antiquus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pluris est universa respublica quam consulatus aut praetura, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:63:2" default="NO" valid="yes">63, 2</bibl> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quinque consulatus eodem tenore gesti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 7</bibl>.—Esp. in the phrases: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 24</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">appetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 63:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 63, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 23, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 73:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 73, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adipisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:26:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 26, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invadere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 14</bibl> et saep.; v. also abdico, fungor, defungor, etc.</sense></entryFree>
consulo: <entryFree id="n10682" type="main" key="consu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭlo</orth>, <itype>lŭi, ltum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n10682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [from con and root sal-; cf. consul and consilium]. </sense><sense id="n10682.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To consider, reflect, deliberate, take counsel, reflect upon, consult</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10682.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10682.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10682.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: quid nunc? etiam consulis? <hi rend="ital">do you still deliberate</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hesitate?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 171</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 75</bibl> Speng.: ne quid in consulendo adversi eveniat, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulto opus est,</quote> <trans><tr>there is need of deliberation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum tempus consulendi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis facere consulentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:42:143" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 42, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnium rerum vobis ad consulendum potestas esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 13, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tot uno tempore motibus animi turbati trepidarent magis quam consulerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium consulenti curiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10682.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere in longitudinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to take thought for the future</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in commune,</quote> <trans><tr>for the common good</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in the same sense: in medium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 335</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:22:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 22, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in publicum (opp. suscipere proprias simultates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello confecto de Rhodiis consultum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de communibus negotiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 105:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 105, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de salute suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 22, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus de rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere vivi ac prospicere debemus, ut illorum (liberorum) solitudo munita sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:58:section=153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 58, § 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu ne qua manus se attollere nobis A tergo possit, custodi et consule longe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 322</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut urbi ... satis esset praesidii, consultum atque provisum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne deficerent, consulendum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4, 31</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10682.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp., consulere alicui or alicui rei, <hi rend="ital">to take care for some person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing, to be mindful of, take care of, look to, have regard for, to counsel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consult for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuae rei bene consulere cupio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid me fiat, parvi pendis, dum illi consulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui parti civium consulunt, partem neglegunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 85</bibl></cit>: consulere eorum commodis et utilitati salutique<pb n="442" /> <cb n="CONS" />  servire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:9:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 9, § 27</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">famae, pudicitiae tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitati meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptui sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reipublicae juxta ac sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 58, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">timori magis quam religioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magis irae quam famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mi consultum optime velit esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: mi ires consultum male? <hi rend="ital">to counsel evil</hi> or <hi rend="ital">badly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 36</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">male patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phoc. 2, 2</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius consulet (sibi), si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10682.10" n="1" level="3"> Consulere aliquem (or aliquid), <hi rend="ital">to consult with one, to ask his opinion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">advice, to ask counsel of, to consult, question</hi> (for the sake of advice). </sense><sense id="n10682.11" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum te consuluissem, quid mihi faciendum esse censeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te, qui philosophum audis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apellem tragoedum, uter, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:33 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 33 al.</bibl></cit>—Of inanim. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">speculum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 136</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatas undas, quid se deceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares, an olerent aera Corinthōn,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:60:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 60, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem de gemmis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:251 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 251 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures meas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suas vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:18 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 18 al.</bibl></cit>—With two <hi rend="ital">accs.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibo et consulam hanc rem amicos, quid faciundum censeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec te id consulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere prudentiorem coepi aetates tabularum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 88</bibl></cit>.—Freq., </sense><sense id="n10682.12" n="b" level="4"> Esp. as t. t. </sense><sense id="n10682.13" n="(a)" level="5"> In the lang. of religion, <hi rend="ital">to consult a deity, an oracle, omens</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinem de re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:16:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 16, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum consuluit auguriis, quae suscipienda essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos hominum fibris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebi oracula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiresiam conjectorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:63" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates nunc extis, nunc per aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 42, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cumaeam anum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:158" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avem primum visam augur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:180" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spirantia exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 64</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">trepidantia exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacras sortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:412" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etrusci haruspices male consulentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:5:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si publice consuletur ... sin privatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 10</bibl></cit>. —With dependent question: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus pontificum collegium consuli jussit, num omne id aurum in ludos consumi necessum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulti per ludibrium pontifices, an concepto necdum edito partu rite nuberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.14" n="(b)" level="5"> In judic. lang., <hi rend="ital">to ask advice of a lawyer, to consult</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam inanes domus eorum omnium, qui de jure civili consuli solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:46:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 46, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuli quidem te a Caesare scribis: sed ego tibi ab illo consuli mallem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si jus consuleres, peritissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus hoc eorum qui consuluntur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who are skilled in the law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">With dependent question: consulens eum, an seni jam testato suaderet ordinare suprema judicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 92</bibl></cit>.—The formula usual in asking advice was, licet consulere? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 13, 28</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 192</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10682.15" n="(g)" level="5"> In publicists' lang., <hi rend="ital">to take counsel with the competent authorities, to consult</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quirites, utrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum de foedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 39, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">62, 10: populum de ejus morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem in omnia (tribuni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:39:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 39, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10682.16" n="2" level="3"> Aliquid. </sense><sense id="n10682.17" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To take counsel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deliberate upon something, to consider</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est consulere quiddam quod tecum volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem delatam consulere ordine non licuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 28, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">consulere et explorare rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulis rem nulli obscuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:344 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 344 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis repulsi Galli quid agant consulunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.18" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To advise something, to give advice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tun' consulis quicquam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 22</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab re consulit blandiloquentulus,</quote> <trans><tr>advises to his hurt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n10682.19" n="II" level="1"> Sometimes meton. (causa pro effectu). </sense><sense id="n10682.20" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take a resolution, resolve, conclude, determine</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10682.21" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> or with <hi rend="ital">de aliquo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in aliquem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de nullis quam de vobis infestius aut inimicius consuluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 29, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de perfugis gravius quam de fugitivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:43:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 43, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in humiliores libidinose crudeliterque consulebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 36, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">crudeliter in deditos victosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 13, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 16</bibl>. <cb n="CONS" /> —</sense><sense id="n10682.22" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in concilio consuluistis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ego inducam tamen, ut illud, quod tuam in rem bene conducat, consulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: ne quid gravius de salute tuā consulas, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pessime istuc in te atque in illum consulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae reges irā inpulsi male consuluerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi quod de uxore potuit honestius consuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 95, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter mihi de illis ac de me ipso consulendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.23" n="B" level="2"> With the access. idea of judging, in the connection boni, optimi aliquid consulere, <hi rend="ital">to excuse, take in good part, interpret favorably; be contented, pleased</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">satisfied with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit consul a consulendo vel a judicando: nam et hoc consulere veteres vocaverunt, unde adhuc remanet illud Rogat boni consulas, id est bonum judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=41:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 41, 8</bibl> Müll.: nemo hoc rex ausus est facere, eane fieri bonis, bono genere gnatis boni consulitis? Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni consulendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=40" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 40</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">tu haec quaeso consule missa boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:8:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 8, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 106</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nostrum laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Prov. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 9, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:17:9" default="NO">17, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:88:17" default="NO">88, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerebat argentum avaritia: boni consuluit interim invenisse minium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33</bibl></cit>, prooem. 2, § 4; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 16, 17, § 44: boni et optimi consulere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 205, 28</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n10682.24" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">consultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10682.25" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Well considered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weighed, deliberated upon, maturely pondered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene consultum consilium surripitur saepissume, si minus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi omnia, quorum negotium est, consulta ad nos et exquisita deferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 250</bibl></cit>: neque eam usquam invenio, neque quo eam, neque quā quaeram consultum'st, <hi rend="ital">I know neither</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">operā consultā,</quote> <trans><tr>with mature reflection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7</bibl></cit> (6), 17, 3; <cit><quote lang="la">in the same sense, consulto consilio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consultius est huic poenalem quoque stipulationem subjungere,</quote> <trans><tr>it is better. more advantageous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 15, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.26" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">Knowing, skilful, experienced, practised</hi>, esp. in law; <hi rend="ital">skilled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">learned in the law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ille magis juris consultus quam justitiae fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris atque eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consultissimus vir omnis divini atque humani juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:13:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 13, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanientis sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universae disciplinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consultus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a lawyer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu consultus modo rusticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep 2, 2, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 83</bibl>.— Esp. with juris, often written as one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrisconsultus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. h. v.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut natura non disciplinā consultus esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 27, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consultorum alterum disertissimum, disertorum alterum consultissimum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:40:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 40, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consultiores sibimet videntur Deo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.27" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consultum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n10682.28" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. 1. b.) <hi rend="ital">A consultation, inquiry of a deity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sostratus (sacerdos) ubi laeta et congruentia exta magnisque consultis annuere deam videt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.29" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">A decree, decision, resolution, plan;</hi> so first, Senatus consultum, or in one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Senatusconsul-tum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a decree of the Senate</hi> (most freq. in all periods; the senatus consulta were not, like the plebiscita, the supreme law of the republic; but under the emperors, all new laws took this form, v. esp. Sandars, Introd., Just. Inst. § 15; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 2, 5),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 42, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus consultum est quod senatus jubet atque constituit, nam cum auctus esset populus Romanus ... aequum visum est senatum vice populi consuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, consulta Patrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 41</bibl></cit>. —Of a decree of the Sicilian council: <cit><quote lang="la">ne senatus consultum Siculi homines facere possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:65:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 65, § 146</bibl></cit>.—Also in other connections: <cit><quote lang="la">facta et consulta fortium et sapientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:24:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 24, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facta consultaque Alexandri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 7</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">consulta et decreta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulta sese omnia cum illo integra habere,</quote> <trans><tr>all objects of consultation, plans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 108:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 108, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab occultis cavendum hominibus consultisque,</quote> <trans><tr>plans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">approbare collegam consulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10</bibl></cit>, <cb n="CONS" /> 39, 10: <cit><quote lang="la">dum consulta petis,</quote> <trans><tr>responses, oracles, divinations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua magna,</quote> <trans><tr>decisions</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 410</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mollia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex consulto factum,</quote> <trans><tr>purposely, voluntarily</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 30, 49</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">adv., considerately, deliberately, designedly, on purpose</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10682.30" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">consultō</orth> (class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">utrum perturbatione aliquā animi an consulto et cogitata fiat injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 8, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:64:5" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 14 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n10682.31" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">consultē</orth> (mostly ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui consulte, docte atque astute cavet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caute atque consulte gesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 38, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 24</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consultatio: <entryFree id="n10683" type="main" key="consulta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. consulto</etym>. <sense id="n10683.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mature deliberation, consideration, consultation</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10683.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n10683.2" n="1" level="3"> Abstr., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:25:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 25, 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 12, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 41 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aliquot dies tenuit ea consultatio, ne non reddita bona belli causā ... essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>. —In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 27, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10683.3" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a subject of consultation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiose de consultationibus suis disputare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:17:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 17, 66</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10683.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., rhet. t. t. </sense><sense id="n10683.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A case proposed for decision, an inquiry concerning a case in law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consultationem proponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum apud C. Caesarem consultatio de poenā Theodoti proponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10683.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A general inquiry upon a subject, a consideration of a principle</hi>, = quaestio infinita (opp.: <cit><quote lang="la">definita controversia certis temporibus ac reis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:28:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 28, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive in infinitis consultationibus disceptatur, sive in iis causis quae in civitate et forensi disceptatione versantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:7:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 7, 33</bibl>; id <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:9:4:1" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 9, 4, 1</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n10683.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An asking of advice, inquiry</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n10683.8" n="A" level="2"> Abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuas litteras exspecto, ut sciam, quid respondeant consultationi meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honesta consultatio, non expedita sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redeunt illi sermones, illae consultationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 8:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 23, 6</bibl></cit>.—So of <hi rend="ital">the questioning of the emperor by the prætor, an asking for instructions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">visa est enim mihi res digna consultatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 96</bibl></cit> (97), 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10683.9" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">the inquiry addressed to an oracle</hi> (transl. of <foreign lang="greek">peu=sis</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17, 50</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de consultationibus in Aponi fontem talos aureos jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consultator: <entryFree id="n10684" type="main" key="consulta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who asks advice, consults</hi> (post-Aug. and rare, for the class. consultor, III.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consultatorius: <entryFree id="n10685" type="hapax" key="consulta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consultator</etym>, <sense id="n10685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to consultation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiae (hostiarum genus, in quo voluntas dei per exta disquiritur), opp. animales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consulte: <entryFree id="n10686" type="main" key="consulte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consulo, <sense id="n10686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consulto: <entryFree id="n10687" type="main" key="consulto_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consulo, <sense id="n10687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10688" type="main" key="consulto2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consulto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>consulo</etym>. <sense id="n10688.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To reflect, consider maturely, to consult, take counsel, deliberate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10688.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.). </sense><sense id="n10688.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illaec illic in consilio duae secreto consultant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec consultanda procurandaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eam rem consultandam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 55, 6</bibl></cit>;
