<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 25, 8 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in senatu res major quaepiam consultata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:23:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 23, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10688.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anquirunt aut consultant, conducat id necne de quo deliberant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">utrum, an</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in illis statuamus consultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decemviri consultant quid opus facto sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 31, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 19, 4</bibl>; 36, 8, 6 al.—</sense><sense id="n10688.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> or <hi rend="ital">super, in</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberare et consultare de officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">de summā rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 25, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:2 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de exitu fortunarum suarum consultabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de bello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de rebus dubiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 53, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 25, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 14, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">44, 35, 6: consultandum super re magnā et atroci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in commune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter ipsam rem, de quā sententiae rogantur, consultabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10688.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <pb n="443" /> <cb n="CONS" /> male corde consultare, <hi rend="ital">to meditate evil in the heart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium consultas diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex re consultas tuā,</quote> <trans><tr>for your own good</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:57:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 57, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 3, 1</bibl>; 24, 22, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:37" default="NO">3, 8, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:15 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 15 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10688.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of language used in counsel: <cit><quote lang="la">pars deliberativa de tempore futuro consultat, quaerit etiam de praeterito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10688.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp.: consultare alicui, <hi rend="ital">to take care of one, have a care for</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">delecti (sc. Patres) reipublicae consultabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 15" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10688.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take a resolution, resolve: Phron.</hi> Abi, abi. <hi rend="ital">Strab.</hi> Consultavi istuc mihi,. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 50</bibl> Weise (<hi rend="ital">loc. corrupt.;</hi> alii aliter).—</sense><sense id="n10688.9" n="II" level="1"> Consultare aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to consult one, to go to for counsel, to ask counsel of</hi>, etc. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quid me consultas, quid agas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">senes ab domo ad consultandum arcessunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me (amantes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:78" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:76:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 76, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrologos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 35</bibl></cit>. In this sense also in the form <orth extent="full" lang="la">consultor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 18</bibl>, acc. to Isa. 40, 14 (in Heb. the <hi rend="ital">Niph.</hi> <foreign />).—<pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10688.10" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">consultātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a resolution, decision</hi>, = consultum (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.) senatus consultata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:455" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 455</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10688.11" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">consultantes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">they who seek advice;</hi> of a lawyer, etc., <hi rend="ital">clients</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 54</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of an oracle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 8, § 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consultor: <entryFree id="n10689" type="main" key="consultor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>consulo</etym>. * <sense id="n10689.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who maturely considers, reflects, takes counsel upon a thing</hi>, etc., Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 5, 6, 8</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 332 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n10689.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who gives counsel, a counsellor, adviser</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10689.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop. (several times in Sallust; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. rare): egomet in agmine, aut in proelio consultor idem et socius periculi vobiscum adero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 47</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 103:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 103, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 61, 15</bibl> Dietsch.—</sense><sense id="n10689.3" n="2" level="3"> Prov.: malum consilium consultori est pessumum, Annal. Max. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 5</bibl> (acc. to Hes. Op. et D. 264: <foreign lang="greek">*(h de\ kakh\ boulh\ tw=| bouleu/santi kaki/sth</foreign>), and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prava incepta consultoribus noxae esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 48, 1</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">sua exempla in consultores recidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10689.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita cupidine atque irā, pessumis consultoribus, grassari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10689.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">He who asks counsel of one, a consulter;</hi> esp. used of him who consults a lawyer in reference to a suit at law, <hi rend="ital">a client</hi> (several times in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. rare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 19, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">bis;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:38:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 38, 112</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 187</bibl></cit> (i. e. qui consulis deum, Schol.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10690" type="main" key="consultor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. 2. consulto <sense id="n10690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consultrix: <entryFree id="n10691" type="hapax" key="consultrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. consultor</etym>, <sense id="n10691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who has a care for, provides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consultrix et provida utilitatum opportunitatumque omnium natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:22:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 22, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consultum: <entryFree id="n10692" type="main" key="consultum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>consulo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, 2.</entryFree>
consultus: <entryFree id="n10693" type="main" key="consultus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>consulo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, 1.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10694" type="main" key="consultus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, for consultum, only in <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 4, 9</bibl>: senatusconsultus a consulendo est dictus.</entryFree>
consum: <entryFree id="n10695" type="main" key="consum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sum</orth>, <itype>fŭi, fŭtūrum or fŏre</itype> (found only in the foll. exs.). <sense id="n10695.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be together with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at the same time, to coexist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si neque alia quaelibet passio lumbricis confuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:8:122" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 8, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10695.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be, to happen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confido confuturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spero confore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 140</bibl></cit>; cf.: ab eo quod est confit, id est perficitur, futurum tempus infinitivi modi confore facit, id est perfectum iri, Don. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
consummabilis: <entryFree id="n10696" type="main" key="consumma_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consummābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consummo</etym>, <sense id="n10696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be perfected, susceptible of completion</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ratio in nobis (opp. consummata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 92:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 92, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 846</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consummatio: <entryFree id="n10697" type="main" key="consumma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consummātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (postAug.). <sense id="n10697.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A casting up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reckoning together, a summing up, a summary view</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10697.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">operarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:13:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitus Europae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 23, 37, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulorum mancipiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10697.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10697.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A union, accumulation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita non haec (poma) sed consummatio omnium nocet,</quote> <trans><tr>not fruit of itself, but the use of it in addition to all other food</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10697.4" n="2" level="3"> In rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a comprehending, connecting together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plura argumenta ad unum effectum deducuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:103" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10697.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A</hi> <cb n="CONS" /> <hi rend="ital">finishing, completing, accomplishing, consummation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">susceptae professionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet res minime consummationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">7: maximarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:55" default="NO">6, 1, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 30, 11</bibl> (for the Heb. <foreign />) et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">alvi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a digestion of food</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 28, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the main proof of their skill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 22</bibl></cit>: PRIMI PILI, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the completed time of service as</hi> primipilus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3453</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consummator: <entryFree id="n10698" type="main" key="consumma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consummātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>consummo</etym>, <sense id="n10698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a completer, finisher</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">novi testamenti (opp. initiator veteris),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 22 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
consummatus: <entryFree id="n10699" type="main" key="consumma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consummātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from consummo.</entryFree>
consummo: <entryFree id="n10700" type="main" key="consummo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-summo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>summa</etym> (not in use before the Aug. per.; most freq. in Quint.). <sense id="n10700.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sum up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10700.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus aedificiorum per arithmeticen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium in assem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:10" default="NO">5, 2, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10700.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of number, <hi rend="ital">to make up, amount to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is numerus consummat ... milia tria et ducenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:10" default="NO">3, 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10700.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring together, unite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consummatam ejus (sc. Scipionis) belli gloriam, spectare,</quote> <trans><tr>the gathered glory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 17, 3</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n10700.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bring about, accomplish, complete, finish, perfect, consummate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10700.5" n="A" level="2"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n10700.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae consummatur partibus una dies,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an intercalary day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:166" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 23, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 17, 3</bibl> supra: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia (ars),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultatem orandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1039" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1039</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parricidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 15, 8 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil felicitate consummari (potest), quod non Augustus repraesentaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:89:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 89, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10700.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Absol., to complete a time of service</hi> (sc. stipendia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10700.8" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make perfect, to complete, perfect, bring to the highest perfection</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10700.9" n="A" level="2"> Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">nec denique ars ulla consummatur ibi, unde oriendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam ante mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 32:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 32, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 31</bibl> (v. the passage in connection): <cit><quote lang="la">ruris exercendi scientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10700.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">Severum consummari mors immatura non passa est,</quote> <trans><tr>to attain to the highest grade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:28" default="NO">10, 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum est consummatus,</quote> <trans><tr>when his education is complete</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unā re consummatur animus, scientiā bonorum ac malorum inmutabili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 28</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">consummātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., brought to the highest degree, perfect, complete, consummate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10700.11" n="A" level="2"> Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">20: scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 21, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur virium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 72:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 72, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10700.12" n="B" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">ne se perfectos protinus atque consummatos putent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:119" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:14" default="NO">10, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:19:1 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 19, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:122" default="NO">10, 1, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">professores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 7, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> not in use.</sense></entryFree>
consumo: <entryFree id="n10701" type="main" key="consu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sūmo</orth>, <itype>sumpsi, sumptum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n10701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> sync. consumpsti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:37" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 37</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> consumpse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 234</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to take wholly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n10701.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10701.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vasti surgunt immensis torquibus orbes, tergaque consumunt pelagus,</quote> <trans><tr>take up, completely cover</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 584</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela omnia solus pectore consumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:640" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 640</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeo tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugulo ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:813" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 813</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum pectore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 745</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 2, 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:54" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10701.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of food, <hi rend="ital">to eat, consume, devour</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">agri multa efferunt quae vel statim consumantur vel mandentur condita vetustati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 17</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 77: fruges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiatum (aprum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">draconem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensas accisis dapibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:125 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 125 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10701.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10701.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to consume, devour, waste, squander, annihilate, destroy, bring to naught, kill</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10701.6" n="a" level="4"> Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">faciat quod lubet: Sumat, consumat, perdat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonium per luxuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona paterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:16" default="NO">3, 11, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem materiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:876" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 876</bibl></cit>: omne <cb n="CONS" /> id aurum in ludos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. 2. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> infra: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes fortunas sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes opes et spes privatas meas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 2:96:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 2, 96, 2</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia flammā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes incendio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum incendio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consumpturis viscera mea flammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: viscera fero morsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulum usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum rubigine,</quote> <trans><tr>to eat, consume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 15</bibl></cit>.—Of time, <hi rend="ital">to spend, pass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horas multas saepe suavissimo sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendo tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:39:section=96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 39, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem altercatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annua tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consumitur vigiliis reliqua pars noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam partem diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:33:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 33, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 14, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies decem in his rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo studio aetatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota nox in exinaniendā nave consumitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25, § 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 23, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos dies per dubitationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 62, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne tempus circa Medeam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuum biduum epulando potandoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42</bibl></cit>: precando Tempora cum blandis verbis, <hi rend="ital">to waste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lose time and words in supplications</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 575</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis diebus et laboribus consumptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 93, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi longa meae consumpsti tempora noctis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:37" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 37</bibl></cit>.—Of strength, feeling, voice, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo tanta commoveri actio non posset, si esset consumpta superiore motu et exhausta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:120" default="NO">4, 2, 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem instans metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam rei nimiā captatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires ipsā subtilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:23" default="NO">3, 11, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 11</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: cum mare, cum terras consumpserit, aëra tentet, i. e.-<hi rend="ital">seek a refuge therein in vain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 161</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10701.7" n="b" level="4"> Of living beings. </sense><sense id="n10701.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To destroy, kill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me vis aliqua morbi aut natura ipsa consumpsisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 37, 90</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos fortuna belli consumpserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 5</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum exercitum fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">siti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:41" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:52:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 52, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senio et maerore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:54:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 54, 1 al.</bibl></cit>—Facete: <cit><quote lang="la">garrulus hunc consumet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10701.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Rarely, <hi rend="ital">to waste, weaken, enervate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inediā et purgationibus et vi ipsius morbi consumptus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 663</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and consumpta membra senectā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10701.10" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10701.11" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To divide, make an exhaustive division of</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">inventio in sex partis consumitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10701.12" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid in aliquā re</hi>, rar. <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (in Cic. only with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>; cf. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 53</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to bestow upon something, to use, employ, spend upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">about something</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10701.13" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam in agrorum emptionibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay out, invest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum in monumento,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium in virorum fortium factis memoriae prodendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in armis plurimum studii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum laboris in rebus falsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam in re unā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium in musicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 13, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10701.14" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In aliquid</hi> (cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)nali/skein ei)/s ti</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">tota in dulces consument ubera natos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 178</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 6, 55: <cit><quote lang="la">umorem in arbusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:11:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona paterna in opera publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam in monumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:40" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10701.15" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid consili Habet, ut consumat nunc, quom nil obsint doli,</quote> <trans><tr>use up, exhaust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 133</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consumptibilis: <entryFree id="n10702" type="main" key="consumpti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consumptĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consumo</etym>, <sense id="n10702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be consumed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">destroyed, transient</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vigor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> An. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consumptio: <entryFree id="n10703" type="main" key="consumpti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consumptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n10703.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A consuming, wasting, consumption</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10703.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An employing, bestowing, application, use</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 22, 32</bibl></cit> (al. sumptione).</sense></entryFree>
consumptor: <entryFree id="n10704" type="main" key="consumptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consumptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a consumer, destroyer</hi> (very rare): omnium ignis (connected with confector), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 41</bibl>.—Of fire, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 7, § 132</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the wasters of their property, spendthrifts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Exc. Controv. 3:1:section=3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Exc. Controv. 3, 1, § 3</bibl>. <pb n="444" /> <cb n="CONS" /></sense></entryFree>
consumptrix: <entryFree id="n10705" type="main" key="consumptrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consumptrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consumptor</etym>, <sense id="n10705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who wastes, consumes</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">terra omnium corporum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 395</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consumptus: <entryFree id="n10706" type="main" key="consumptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consumptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from consumo.</entryFree>
consuo: <entryFree id="n10707" type="main" key="consu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŭo</orth>, <itype>sŭi, sūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n10707.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sew, stitch</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">join together</hi> (very rare; mostly ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n10707.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 79</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">lumbulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:8" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:2" default="NO">7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO">8, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10707.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: consuere dolos, <hi rend="ital">to devise, plan, plot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consutis dolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 211</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to forbid to speak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 4</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n10707.3" n="II" level="1"> In gen.: consuere aliquid aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to stuff, stop up, fill with something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinacothecas veteribus tabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>. —Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">consūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a garment stitched together</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, § 192</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consupplicatrix: <entryFree id="n10708" type="main" key="consuppli^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-supplĭcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>supplico</etym>, <sense id="n10708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who supplicates with</hi> (rare), Claud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 66</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1501</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consurgo: <entryFree id="n10709" type="main" key="consurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-surgo</orth>, <itype>surrexi, surrectum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to raise one's self, to rise</hi> (esp. of a multitude), <hi rend="ital">to rise up together, stand up, arise</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10709.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10709.2" n="A" level="2"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Athenis ludis quidam in theatrum grandis natu venisset ... consurrexisse omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 18, 63</bibl></cit>; so, out of respect, <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque in curiam venimus: honorifice consurgitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:62:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 62, § 138</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">in venerationem tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:54:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(in concilio Germanorum) consurgunt ii, qui et causam et hominem probant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consurrexit senatus cum clamore ad unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex insidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum ... consurrexisse et petisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:57:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 57, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi triarii consurrexerunt integri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 570</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consurgere tonsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consurgitur ex consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in plausus consurrectum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leniter est consurgendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:156 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 156 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toro consurgere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad iterandum ictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 749</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 17, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad finitimorum motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad novas res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10709.3" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate subjects (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">consurgeret aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1111</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 498</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:929" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 929</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:474" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 474</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de terra ignis corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:886" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 886</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in auras corpora sponte suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1020" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1020</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare imo fundo ad aethera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terno ordine remi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen earum in tantam altitudinem consurgit quantam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa leniter et sensim clivo fallente consurgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consurgunt geminae quercus,</quote> <trans><tr>grow up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 681</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugata vineta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gelidas consurgens Caucasus Arctos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:155" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantamque operis consurgere molem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 1:499" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 499</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10709.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10709.5" n="A" level="2"> Of living beings; constr., <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi>, also <hi rend="ital">absol., to rise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stand up for any</hi> (esp. a hostile) <hi rend="ital">action</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 19, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad novas res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in iras truces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:673" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 17, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aemulationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consurgunt iterum partes,</quote> <trans><tr>rise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 692</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nostri curam consurge tuendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:71" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmine Maeonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 3, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10709.6" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">to arise, take rise</hi> (like A., perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vespere ab atro consurgunt venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of winds: e terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 43, 44, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitoque novum consurgere bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 637</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 91:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 91, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā concitatione consurgat ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama consurgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:75" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consurrectio: <entryFree id="n10710" type="main" key="consurrecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consurrectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consurgo</etym>, <sense id="n10710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standing up</hi> (as a sign of assent in public transactions) (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the foll. exs.): judicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium vestrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consus: <entryFree id="n10711" type="main" key="Consus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Consus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. from condo</etym>, <sense id="n10711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient deity of Italy, a god of the earth and of agriculture, giver of fertility, presiding over counsels and secret plans</hi>: CONSVS. CONSILIO. MARS. DVELLO. LARES. COMITIO. POTENTES., old. inscr. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 636</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Verr. 1:10:31" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Verr. 1, 10, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 54</bibl>.—Hence Romulus consecrated to him the games instituted with the purpose of attracting the Sabine women, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl>, where this deity is called Neptunus Equester; cf. also Serv. l. l. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyl. 12</bibl> de deis. This festival,<cb n="CONT" />  subsequently celebrated annually by the Romans, called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Consŭālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, fell on the 21st of August, and at this time the altar of the god, at the lower end of the Circus Maximus, was uncovered, though heaped with earth all the rest of the year, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:199 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 199 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 20</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=41:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 41, 15</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 5</bibl>; Dict. of Antiq. s. v. Consualia.</sense></entryFree>
consusurro: <entryFree id="n10712" type="hapax" key="consu^surro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŭsurro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to whisper together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consutilis: <entryFree id="n10713" type="hapax" key="consu_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consūtĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consuo</etym>, <sense id="n10713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sewed together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crate praecinctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consutum: <entryFree id="n10714" type="main" key="consu_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. consuo.</entryFree>
consutus: <entryFree id="n10715" type="main" key="consu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from consuo.</entryFree>
contabefacio: <entryFree id="n10716" type="hapax" key="conta_be^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tābĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>cĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to waste away, to wear out, consume</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem (curā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contabesco: <entryFree id="n10717" type="main" key="conta_besco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tābesco</orth>, <itype>tābŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to waste away gradually, to be consumed, pine away</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n10717.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: cor guttatim contabescit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 92</bibl>: Artemisia luctu confecta contabuit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 31, 75</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10717.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">o perfidiosae Fregellae, quam facile scelere vestro contabuistis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 15, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contabulatio: <entryFree id="n10718" type="main" key="conta^bu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contăbŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contabulo</etym>, <sense id="n10718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining of boards together, a flooring, planking; a floor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">story, a covering of boards</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl> (four times); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscenii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10718.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of garments, <hi rend="ital">folds, tucks</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 258, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contabulo: <entryFree id="n10719" type="main" key="conta^bu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tăbŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to furnish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cover with boards</hi> (several times in the histt.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. rare): turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres contabulatas machimentaque alia quatiendis muris portabant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>built in stories</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 16, 18, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum murum ex omni parte turribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimentum quernis axibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 62, § 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare molibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to furnish with a bridge, to bridge over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:7:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. Hellespontum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contabundus: <entryFree id="n10720" type="main" key="conta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. cunctabundus.</entryFree>
contactus: <entryFree id="n10721" type="main" key="contactus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. contingo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10722" type="main" key="contactus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contactus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. contingo</etym> (except once in Sall., perh. not ante-Aug.), <sense id="n10722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a touching, touch, contact</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10722.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:50" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 15, 16, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:122" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 7, 40, § 122</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">viriles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 239</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10722.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a touching of something unclean, a contagion, infection</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10722.3" n="A" level="2"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 26, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10722.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (several times in Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">neu patiamini licentiam scelerum, quasi tabem, ad integros contactu procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 48, 9</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:21:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 21, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos a contactu dominationis inviolatos habebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">contactu valentiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">discedite a contactu ac dividite turbidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contactu bellum meditari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contages: <entryFree id="n10723" type="main" key="conta_ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāges</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contact, touch</hi> (Lucretian), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 734</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:337" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 337</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 280</bibl> and 1242.</sense></entryFree>
contagio: <entryFree id="n10724" type="main" key="conta_gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāgĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">contāgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (contagium only in poets—and in <number>plur.</number>—and in postAug. prose writers; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=59:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 59, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 199, 2</bibl>; Marc. Vict. 1, p. 2469 P.; cf. also colluvio: contamen only in late Lat.) [id.], <sense id="n10724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a touching, contact, touch</hi>, in a good or bad sense. </sense><sense id="n10724.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10724.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Contagio, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 132 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima calescit ... contagione pulmonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 30, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 43, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni mentione et contagione Romanorum abstinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 20, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10724.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Contagium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 346</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:740" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 740</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 20, 18, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:47" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10724.4" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">a union, connection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contagio naturae valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10724.5" n="II" level="1"> Freq., in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a contacl with something physically</hi> or <hi rend="ital">morally unclean, a contagion, infection</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10724.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10724.7" n="(a)" level="5"> Contagio: nolite ad me adire, ne contagio mea bonis obsit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 405 Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 164</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut contagione quādam pestiferā insanire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 34, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum praecipue oves contagione vexentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lichenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 1, 3</bibl></cit>, <cb n="CONT" /> § <cit><quote lang="la">3: vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:134 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 21, 27, § 134 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10724.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Contagium: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 472</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1235" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 1</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pestilentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 80, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicini pecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 51</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">agunt contagia late,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 551</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:61 al" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 61 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10724.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an infection, pollution, vicious companionship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intercourse, participation, contamination</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10724.10" n="(a)" level="5"> Contagio: <cit><quote lang="la">contagione mei patris metuo malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 31</bibl></cit>; so with the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 37, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:71:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 71, § 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 24, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus facti dictive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 37, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitandi belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 68, 193</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contagiones malorum, quae a Lacedaemoniis profectae manaverunt latius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 80</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: haec (vitia) primo paulatim crescere; post, ubi contagio quasi pestilentia invasit, civitas immutata, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:18:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 18, 2 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:9:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 9, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10724.11" n="(b)" level="5"> Contagium: <cit><quote lang="la">aegrae mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucri (connected with scabies),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:15:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:14:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 195</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10724.12" n="(g)" level="5"> Contamen, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. adv. Marc. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 10</bibl> Kopp.</sense></entryFree>
contagiosus: <entryFree id="n10725" type="main" key="conta_gi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāgĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contagio, II.</etym>, <sense id="n10725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contagious</hi> (perh. only in Veg.): <cit><quote lang="la">passio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scabies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 70, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contagium: <entryFree id="n10726" type="main" key="conta_gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. contagio.</entryFree>
contamen: <entryFree id="n10727" type="main" key="conta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmen</orth>, <itype>inis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. contagio.</entryFree>
contaminabilis: <entryFree id="n10728" type="main" key="conta_mi^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmĭnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contamen</etym>, <sense id="n10728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be polluted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defiled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propheta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 20</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 9, 16.</sense></entryFree>
