contaminatio: <entryFree id="n10729" type="main" key="conta_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contamino</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n10729.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A polluting, contamination, defilement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expositionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 168</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10729.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Corruption, disease</hi>: ventris, Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Obseq.</author> Prodig. 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contaminator: <entryFree id="n10730" type="main" key="conta_mi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a defiler, polluter</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">honorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterni tori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contaminatus: <entryFree id="n10731" type="main" key="conta_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. contamino.</entryFree>
contamino: <entryFree id="n10732" type="main" key="conta_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tāmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>from stem tag, tango</etym>. <sense id="n10732.0" n="I" level="1"> Orig., <hi rend="ital">to bring into contact, touch</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10732.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">manus quibus contaminatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: contaminare, contingere, Gloss. ap. Mai, Auct. Class. VI. p. 518 a.—</sense><sense id="n10732.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring into union, to mingle, blend together, unite</hi>. So twice in Ter. of the blending of parts of different comedies into one whole: <cit><quote lang="la">multas Graecas fabulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. prol. 16</bibl>; cf. upon this Grauert, Analekten. p. 116 sq.—</sense><sense id="n10732.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To deteriorate by mingling, corrupt, contaminate, defile, stain, pollute</hi> (something by something; very freq., esp. in the trop. signif., and in Cic.; not in Quint.). </sense><sense id="n10732.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">deam Syriam urinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus (connected with spurcare aquas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:11:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 20</bibl></cit>.—Of unnatural vice: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenuos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 108, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10732.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium aegritudine aliquā,</quote> <trans><tr>to mar, efface</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se humanis vitiis (joined with se inquinare domesticis vitiis atque flagitiis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem suum lege (Canuleia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes, i. e. by adoption into a plebeian family,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines neglegentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatem aliquo mendacio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:16:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 16, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem omni scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 35</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">se sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese maleficio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ipsos ac domos suas nefanda praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18, 8 al.</bibl></cit>—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contaminati facinore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 43</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tot parricidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis flagitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 35, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus probris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia vitio paucorum (joined with corrupta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:21:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 21, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum assiduo usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmĭnā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., stained with guilt, polluted, contaminated, impure, vile, defiled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ut consceleratos contaminatosque ab ludis abactos esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 37, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pars civitatis, velut contaminata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:194 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 68, 194 al.</bibl></cit>—So several times of incontinence, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene omnibus membris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: homo sceleribus<pb n="445" /> <cb n="CONT" />  flagitiisque contaminatissimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 9, 23</bibl>.—<pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10732.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmĭnāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">abandoned youths</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10732.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmĭ-nāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">adulterated things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut anteponantur ... integra contaminatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 18, 69</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> not in use.</sense></entryFree>
contanter: <entryFree id="n10733" type="main" key="contanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>cunctor</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, 1. <sense id="n10733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
contarii: <entryFree id="n10734" type="gloss" key="conta_ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contus</etym>, <sense id="n10734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of soldiers armed with pikes, pike-bearers</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kontofo/roi</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 40, 2</bibl> and 3.</sense></entryFree>
contatio: <entryFree id="n10735" type="main" key="conta_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. cunctatio.</entryFree>
contatus: <entryFree id="n10736" type="main" key="conta_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>cunctor</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10737" type="main" key="conta_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contus</etym>, <sense id="n10737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soldier armed with a pike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pole</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kontofo/ros</foreign>, a kind of troops = contarii, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
contechnor: <entryFree id="n10738" type="hapax" key="contechnor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-technor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>techna</etym>, <sense id="n10738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to devise plots, contrive tricks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide modo ne illic sit contechnatus quipiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contectus: <entryFree id="n10739" type="main" key="contectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. contego.</entryFree>
contego: <entryFree id="n10740" type="main" key="conte^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĕgo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to cover, to cover up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n10740.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10740.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquid aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coria centonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">locum linteis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 38, 5</bibl></cit>: capita scutis, Auct. B. Afr. 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput glauco amictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:885" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 885</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se corbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 38, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliis contectum juvenis corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pelle contectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus ejus (tumulus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">thus of burying: eos uno tumulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 25, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:9:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:58" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus Galbae humili sepulturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in privatis ejus hortis, omnia nebulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 22, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquo ramorum contexu contegi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl> supra.—</sense><sense id="n10740.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam servili habitu, alii fide clientium contecti,</quote> <trans><tr>covered, protected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10740.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10740.5" n="A" level="2"> With the access. idea of preservation (cf. condo), <hi rend="ital">to preserve, keep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum arma omnia reposita contectaque essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n10740.6" n="B" level="2"> With the access. idea of concealment, <hi rend="ital">to conceal by covering, to cover, hide, conceal</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10740.7" n="1" level="3"> Of corporeal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">eas partes corporis contexit atque abdidit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 126</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10740.8" n="2" level="3"> Of abstr. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">factam injuriam illi miserae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidines fronte et supercilio, non pudore et temperantiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperire et recludere contecta victricium partium vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contegendis quae prima aetas et summa fortuna expeterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 13</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 7, 4, 21.</sense></entryFree>
contemero: <entryFree id="n10741" type="main" key="conte^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĕmĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to stain, pollute, defile</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">torum dominae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 10:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 10, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contemnenter: <entryFree id="n10742" type="main" key="contemnenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemnenter</orth>, <sense id="n10742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., in a contemptuous manner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 515, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemnificus: <entryFree id="n10743" type="hapax" key="contemni^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemnĭ-fĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contemno-facio</etym>, <sense id="n10743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">despising, contemptuous, scornful</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 88, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemno: <entryFree id="n10744" type="main" key="contemno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-temno</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">contempno</orth>; cf. Ritschl Prol. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> p. 103</bibl>), tempsi (-temsi), temptum (-temtum), 3, <sense id="n10744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to consider a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing as unimportant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of small value, to value little, esteem lightly, contemn, despise, disdain, defy, not to fear</hi>, etc. (very freq. in connection with irridere, despicere, non curare, pro nihilo ducere, etc.; opp.: expetere, efferre, timere, metuere, etc.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> and cf. aspernor; fre[qacute]. and class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10744.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10744.2" n="A" level="2"> With things as objects: <cit><quote lang="la">quodque ea, quae plerique vehementer expetunt, contemnant et pro nihilo ducant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis voluptatem contemni et reici oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum exercitum prae Gallicanis legionibus ... magno opere contemno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam prae suā Capuā irridebunt atque contemnent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non usque eo L. Catilina rem publicam despexit atque contempsit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 37, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (virtutem) ... reliquā ex collatione facile est conterere atque contemnere,</quote> <trans><tr>in consequence of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:30:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 30, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Isocrates videtur testimonio Platonis aliorum judicia debere contemnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna sunt ea, quae dico: noli haec contemnere (= levia habere),</quote> <trans><tr>esteem lightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 39</bibl></cit>: nullam rem in me esse quam ille contemnat (= non timeat), nullam in se quam <cb n="CONT" /> pertimescat, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 23</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. metuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim refutanda tantum, quae e contrario dicuntur, sed contemnenda, elevanda, ridenda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 10</bibl></cit> Spald.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:38 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 38 al.</bibl> (cf. under II.): <cit><quote lang="la">imperium meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmura ponti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1045" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1045</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare res humanas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva ista,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem bene dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. 14: <cit><quote lang="la">metum jurisjurandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:6:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus Apollineos prae se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antoni gladios potuit contemnere (Cicero),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:123" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucitatem in hoste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 28</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullas illa suis contemnet fletibus aras,</quote> <trans><tr>neglect, leave unvisited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:4:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 4, 23</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10744.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non contemnas lippus inungi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">coronari Olympia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 197" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 197</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10744.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut irascatur judex ... faveat, contemnat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:38:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 38, 131</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10744.5" n="(d)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">part. fut. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (amplitudo animi) maxime eminet contemnendis et despiciendis doloribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">documenta in contemnendis animalibus,</quote> <trans><tr>despicable, contemptible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 29, 43, § 104</bibl></cit>. —Esp. freq. with a negative: <cit><quote lang="la">(orationes) non contemnendae saneque tolerabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:273" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 79, 273</bibl></cit>; cf. under II.—</sense><sense id="n10744.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of things as subjects, <hi rend="ital">to defy, be safe from, not to fear, to make light of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adamantina saxa ictus contemnere sueta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 448</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 380</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1216" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1216</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemnere ventos, of the island of Delos, because protected from the winds by the surrounding islands,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 360</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemnunt mediam temeraria lina Charybdim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10744.7" n="B" level="2"> With personal objects: a te contemni ac despici ac pro nihilo haberi senatum volunt, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 436, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemni se putant (senes), despici, illudi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 18, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 10, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes istos deridete atque contemnite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 24</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemnere miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit> et saep. —Se contemnere, <hi rend="ital">to put a small value upon one's self, to have an humble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">low opinion of one's self.</hi> (opp.: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi satisplacere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 21</bibl>; and inversely: se non contemnere, <hi rend="ital">to have a high regard for</hi> or <hi rend="ital">estimate of one's self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 35, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec (Batavi) tributis contemnuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>are humiliated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10744.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res illis contemnentibus perniciei fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10744.9" n="b" level="4"> In <hi rend="ital">part. fut. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne T. quidem Postumius contemnendus in dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:77:269" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 77, 269</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:69:231" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 69, 231</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae neque numero neque genere hominum contemnendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>considerable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10744.10" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to slight, speak contemptuously of, disparage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contempsisti L. Murenae genus, extulisti tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:17:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 17, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 16, 59</bibl>: populi contemnere voces, Sic. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 65</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temtus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., despised, despicable, contemptible, vile, abject</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">comtemptus et abjectus homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contempta ac sordida vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a vili contemptoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 25</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trebellius per avaritiam ac sordes contemptus exercitui invisusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 60</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vox potest esso contemptior, quam Milonis Crotoniatae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:57:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 57, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ter. 2</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemptissimorum consulum levitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 16, 36</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 15</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temtē</orth>), <hi rend="ital">contemptibly, despicably;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> contemptius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 12:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl> (but not <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 47</bibl>; v. contemptim).</sense></entryFree>
contemperatio: <entryFree id="n10745" type="main" key="contempe^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contempĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contempero</etym>, <sense id="n10745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suitable mixture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 2:30" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 2, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contempero: <entryFree id="n10746" type="main" key="contempe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tempĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to moderate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">temper by mixing</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not ante-Aug.): cantharum mulso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 246, 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 6, 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemplabilis: <entryFree id="n10747" type="main" key="contempla_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contemplor</etym>, <sense id="n10747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">aiming, taking aim</hi> (only in Amm.): <cit><quote lang="la">dextera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.— * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplābĭlĭter</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferire aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>taking aim</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 7, 9</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CONT" /></sense></entryFree>
contemplabundus: <entryFree id="n10748" type="hapax" key="contempla_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contemplor</etym>, <sense id="n10748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">considering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contemplating attentively</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemplatio: <entryFree id="n10749" type="main" key="contempla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an attentive considering, a viewing, surveying, contemplation</hi> (in good prose). </sense><sense id="n10749.1" n="I" level="1"> Physical. </sense><sense id="n10749.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 42, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injecit contemplationem super umeros,</quote> <trans><tr>cast a look over</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 12, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10749.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an aiming with a weapon, a taking aim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittis praecipuā contemplatione utantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 194</bibl></cit>; cf. contemplabilis.—</sense><sense id="n10749.4" n="II" level="1"> Mental. </sense><sense id="n10749.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a contemplation, survey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est animorum ingeniorumque naturale quoddam quasi pabulum consideratio contemplatioque naturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 41, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:86" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 86</bibl></cit>; in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recti pravique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum, scripti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicae felicitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:9:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa vis infinitatis et magnā ac diligenti contemplatione dignissima est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 50</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 12</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10749.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a consideration, regard</hi> (mostly late Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. in the jurists): liberorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:5:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 15, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:5" default="NO">3, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:58" default="NO">18, 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3161</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">contemplatione mortis donatio facta, = mortis causā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 23, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contemplativus: <entryFree id="n10750" type="main" key="contempla_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contemplative, speculative</hi>: philosophia (opp. activa), <hi rend="ital">theoretical</hi> (formed after the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qewrhtiko/s</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae pars, Aug. Civ. Dei, 8, 4: vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contemplator: <entryFree id="n10751" type="main" key="contempla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n10751.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An observer, surveyor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritissimus,</quote> <trans><tr>a marksman</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10751.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A contemplator, an observer</hi> (very rare): caeli ac deorum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 8:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4</bibl></cit>, n. 18, p. 361, 4.</sense></entryFree>
contemplatorius: <entryFree id="n10752" type="gloss" key="contempla_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplātōrĭus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">stoxastiko/s</foreign>, Gloss. Cyrill.</entryFree>
contemplatrix: <entryFree id="n10753" type="main" key="contempla_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contemplator</etym>, <sense id="n10753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who observes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contemplates</hi> (very rare): medicina, Cels. praef. 1, prooem. § 91; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 16, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemplatus: <entryFree id="n10754" type="main" key="contempla_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from contemplor and contemplo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10755" type="main" key="contempla_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contemplor</etym>. <sense id="n10755.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A consideration, contemplation, observance</hi> (very rare, and only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:66" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 66</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10755.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Regard, respect</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemplo: <entryFree id="n10756" type="main" key="contemplo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (anteand post-class.; collat. form of contemplor), <sense id="n10756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to survey, behold, observe, consider, contemplate</hi>, etc.; freq. in <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adspecta et contempla, Epidice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: contempla et templum Cereris ad laevam aspice, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 9</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 470, 5</bibl>; Att. and <bibl default="NO"><author>Titin.</author> ib. p. 469, 31</bibl>, and 470, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:38 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 38 al.</bibl>: contemplo placide formam et faciem virginis, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 469, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 285</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 21 al.</bibl>— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Fragm. de Aucup. 3, p. 49</bibl> Stern.—</sense><sense id="n10756.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse ab contemplato situ Carthaginis rediit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 36, 6</bibl></cit> dub.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">scripta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 15, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contemplor: <entryFree id="n10757" type="main" key="contemplor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-templor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (arch. <sense id="n10757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> contemplarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 10</bibl>), <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>templum, I. A.</etym> (orig. pertaining to the lang. of augury; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 9</bibl> Müll.), <hi rend="ital">to look at, view attentively, to survey, behold, gaze upon, give attention to, observe, consider, contemplate</hi>, = considero (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10757.1" n="I" level="1"> Physically. </sense><sense id="n10757.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: sed Is hac abiit; <cit><quote lang="la">contemplabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis ut contemplata modo sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemplator, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:189" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 189</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 187</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10757.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj. acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum intueor et contemplor unumquemque vestrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemplari unum quidque otiose et considerare coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:15:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 15, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum caelum suspeximus caelestiaque contemplati sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis pulchritudlnem rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 38, 98</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci naturam ab omni parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: vultum, Ter. <pb n="446" /> <cb n="CONT" /> Phorm. 1, 4, 32: <cit><quote lang="la">lituras codicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:16:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 16, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummos in arcā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">udum Tibur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 29, 6 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10757.4" n="II" level="1"> Mentally (several times in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">propone tibi duos reges, et id animo contemplare, quod oculis non potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid secum considerare et contemplari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 43, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut totam causam acerrime contemplemini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 77</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemporalis: <entryFree id="n10758" type="main" key="contempo^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tempŏrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n10758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., contemporary; subst., a contemporary</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 6 sq.</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
contemporaneus: <entryFree id="n10759" type="main" key="contempo^ra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tempŏrānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tempus</etym>, <sense id="n10759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contemporary; subst., a contemporary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Varro et Nigidius Caesari et Ciceroni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 14</bibl></cit> inscr.</sense></entryFree>
contemporo: <entryFree id="n10760" type="main" key="contempo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tempŏro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be at the same time, to be contemporary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contempte: <entryFree id="n10761" type="main" key="contempte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temtē</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. contemno, <sense id="n10761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
contemptibilis: <entryFree id="n10762" type="main" key="contempti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temt-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contemno</etym>, <sense id="n10762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contemptible</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:37" default="NO">21, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 155</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemptibilitas: <entryFree id="n10763" type="main" key="contempti^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptĭbĭlĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temt-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contemptibilis</etym>, <sense id="n10763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contemptibleness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5:158" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5, 158</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemptim: <entryFree id="n10764" type="main" key="contemptim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptim</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temt-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contemno</etym>, <sense id="n10764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contemptuously, with contempt, scornfully</hi> (a favorite word of Livy; elsewhere rare): superbiter contemptim conterit legiones, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 516, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">imitated: ne nos tam contemptim conteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnifice de se ac contemptim de Romanis loquentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbe quaedam et contemptim in se contionantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 35, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:12" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 56, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte consulis succedentes ad castra Romana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 38, 8</bibl> Drak.: a Dioxippo contemptim militarem eludente ferociam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 58</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagabantur barbari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 47</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n10764.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf. of an inanimate subject: e summo, quasi fulmen, deicit ictos Invidia contemptim in Tartara, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemptio: <entryFree id="n10765" type="main" key="contempti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temt-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a despising; disregard, contempt, scorn, disdain</hi> (in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum humanarum contemptio ac despicientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudo est dolorum laborumque contemptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 33, 117</bibl></cit>; id. Rep. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 201, 30</bibl>; Hortens. Fragm. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 202, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis perpetua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:8:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum inmortalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 41, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jam non solum hostibus in contemptionem Sabinus veniret, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>was despised by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(adversarii) in contemptionem adducentur, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:16:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 16, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contemptor: <entryFree id="n10766" type="main" key="contemptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temt-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who puts small value upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">makes light of a thing, a contemner, despiser</hi> (freq. after the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Hor.): divum Mezentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 648</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">superūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni Olympi cum dis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:761" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 761</bibl></cit>: religionum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiae, divitiarum (Cato),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae infamiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sui (opp. prodigus alieni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amulius aequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri, nullo forabilis ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 170</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnerum leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 18, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 240</bibl>: (Cicero) minime sui contemptor, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 20</bibl> (cf. contemno, II.).—</sense><sense id="n10766.1" n="II" level="1"> Of abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">lucis animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 205</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitionis animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:55:9" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 55, 9</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> as <pos>adj.</pos>: cui inerat contemptor animus et superbia, <hi rend="ital">a proud, disdainful spirit</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemptrix: <entryFree id="n10767" type="main" key="contemptrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temt-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contemptor</etym>, <sense id="n10767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who puts small value upon a thing, a despiser, contemner</hi> (rare; not in Cic.): mea, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 2</bibl>: superūm propago, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 161</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10767.1" n="II" level="1"> Of inanimate and abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">contemptrix frigorum eruca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 44, § 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:59" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 4, 15, § 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudo contemptrix timendorum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:411" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 411</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contemptus: <entryFree id="n10768" type="main" key="contemptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Part. and P. a.</hi>, from contemno. <cb n="CONT" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10769" type="main" key="contemptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temt-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contemno</etym>, <sense id="n10769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a despising, contemning; contempt, scorn</hi> (first freq. since the Aug. per., but esp. so in Quint.; perh. never in Cic., for in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11, 4</bibl>, prob. the thought only is Ciceronian). </sense><sense id="n10769.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., a despising</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(naribus labrisque) derisus, contemptus, fastidium significari solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis et hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 30</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 38</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis infamiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui alienique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc superbum apparatum ... sequebantur contemptus omnium hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10769.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass., a being despised</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpis enim ferme contemptus et acris egestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ego contemptūs essem patientior hujus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:859" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 859</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemptu inter socios nomen Romanum laborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si contemptum ex humilitate tulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 14, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:527 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 527 al.</bibl>— In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:831" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 831</bibl> and 1277.—</sense><sense id="n10769.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an object of contempt</hi>, in phrase contemptui esse or habere, <hi rend="ital">to despise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerumque hominibus Gallis prae magnitudine corporum suorum brevitas nostra contemptui est,</quote> <trans><tr>is despised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eviluit, ut contemptui esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteras (caerimonias) contemptui habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 93 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
contendo: <entryFree id="n10770" type="main" key="contendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tendo</orth>, <itype>di, tum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n10770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch, stretch out vigorously, to draw tight, strain</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10770.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">arcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:815" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 815</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 286</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 435</bibl>: tormenta, Sisen. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 258, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 57</bibl>: muscipula, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 181, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenacia vincla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilia risu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 285</bibl></cit>: pontem in alto, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 21</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 358 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">oculi contendunt se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:810" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 810</bibl></cit>.— Of stringed instruments, <hi rend="ital">to tune by stretching the strings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in fidibus pluribus, si nulla earum ita contenta nervis sit, ut concentum servare possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <itype>infra</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>—</sense><sense id="n10770.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10770.3" n="1" level="3"> (Causa pro effectu.) Of weapons, <hi rend="ital">to shoot, hurl, dart, throw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infensam hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 815</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittas nervo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:323" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum aërias in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 520</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10770.4" n="2" level="3"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">neutr., to stretch, reach, extend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec patulum vallis contendit in orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:7:30" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cappadocum gens usque ad Cyrresticam ejus regionem parte suā, quae vocatur Cataonia, contendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 8, 8, § 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (freq. in prose and poetry); <hi rend="ital">act., to strain eagerly, to stretch, exert, to direct one's mental powers to something, to pursue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strive for earnestly;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">neutr., to exert one's self, to strive zealously for something</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10770.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10770.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10770.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum fortasse onus, verum tamen dignum, in quo omnis nervos aetatis industriaeque meae contenderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contendit omnis nervos Chrysippus, ut persuadeat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:10:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summas vires de palmā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:990" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 990</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum in curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo se dira libido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1043" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1043</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen id sibi contendendum aut aliter non transducendum exercitum existimabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">id contendere et laborare, ne ea, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21:section=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21, § 52</bibl>: et petere imperium populi et contendere honores, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 259, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf., to exert one's self vigorously to do something, to apply one's self with zeal to, to go to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc locum duabus ex partibus oppugnare contendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā vi transcendere in hostium naves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugā salutem petere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:125" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 125</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego nunc hoc contendo ... mutare animum, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:13:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 13, § 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum coniti animo potes, quantum labore contendere ... tantum fac ut efficias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quántum potero voce contendam, ut populus hoc Romanus exaudiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">remis, ut eam partem insulae caperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">contende quaeso atque elabora, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:14:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 14, § 42</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vociferarer et, quantum maxime possem, contenderem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 16, 38 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possis oculo quantum contendere Lynceus (= collineare),</quote> <trans><tr>to aim at</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic., </sense><sense id="n10770.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To direct</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bend one's course eagerly somewhere;</hi> <cb n="CONT" /> or, <hi rend="ital">neutr., to strive to get to a place, to seek to arrive at, to go, march</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">journey hastily to</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10770.13" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10770.14" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">rectā plateā cursum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte unā tantum itineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.15" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">Bibracte ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ire cum his legionibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Britanniam proficisci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in provinciam reverti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dyrrhachium petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41, 97</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">proxima litora petere cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 158</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">iter a Vibone Brundisium terrā petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 40, 96</bibl></cit> Wund.—</sense><sense id="n10770.16" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">in Italiam magnis itineribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huc magnis itineribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc magno cursu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde in Italiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fines Sigambrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo loco ad flumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Rhenum finesque Germanorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad oppidum Noviodunum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad castra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 3, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hostes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Amanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: Tarentum ad Heraclidem Ponticum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 260, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacedaemonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ultimum animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 31, 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magna spectare atque ad ea rectis studiis contendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summam laudem gloriamque maximis laboribus et periculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10770.17" n="2" level="3"> (<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>) <hi rend="ital">To measure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">try one's strength with</hi>, with weapons, by words, in action, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to strive, dispute, fight, contend against, vie with;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum aliquo, contra</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adversus aliquem</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">dat., inter se</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10770.18" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Cum aliquo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque post id tempus umquam summis nobiscum copiis hostes contenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Sequanis bello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 67</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum magnis legionibus parvā manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 53, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum barbaro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum victore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mecum ingenio et arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 24, 23 al.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo de principatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 1:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 1, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiis et sumptibus, non probitate neque industriā cum majoribus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilitas cum dignitate et amplitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc.
