Am. 47, 136</bibl></cit>.—So with <case>acc.</case> of <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamenne vereris, ut possis haec contra Hortensium contendere?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 25, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.19" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Contra aliquem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra populum Romanum armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauri pro vitulis contra leones summā vi impetuque contendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra vim gravitatemque morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil contra naturam universam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 101</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10770.20" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Adversus aliquem</hi>: non contendam ego adversus te, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl>, A, 2.—</sense><sense id="n10770.21" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">hirundo cycnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:7" default="NO">1, 14, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pindaricis plectris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:101" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 101</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi cum tantopere de potentatu inter se multos annos contenderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viribus inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:784" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 784</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim proelio equestri inter duas acies contendebatur,</quote> <trans><tr>the contest was carried on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 50</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 28 al.: magis virtute quam dolo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">translatio non habet quaestionem, de quā contendit orator, sed propter quam contendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:3 al" default="NO">7, 9, 3 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo jure contenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de his lite contenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de personis judicatur, sed de rebus contenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10770.22" n="b" level="4"> In auctions, <hi rend="ital">to vie with in bidding, to bid against</hi>: is liceri non destitit; <cit><quote lang="la">illi quoad videbatur ferri aliquo modo posse, contenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:42:section=99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 42, § 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.23" n="3" level="3"> (<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>) <hi rend="ital">To place together in comparison, to compare, contrast;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum, ad</hi>, the <case>dat.</case>, or <case>acc.</case> only. </sense><sense id="n10770.24" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: tuam iram contra cum ira Liberi, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 259, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:ib. p. 259:1" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> ib. p. 259, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id cum defensione nostrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:33:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 33, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem meam cum tuā ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:32 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 32 al.</bibl>: suam vitam mecum, Licinius, Macer. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 259, 3</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10770.25" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: ut vim contendas tuam ad majestatem viri, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 259, 5</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 648 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n10770.26" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: Thestiadas Ledae, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 258, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera potantia Aquinatem fucum Sidonio ostro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 14 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10770.27" n="(d)" level="5"> With <pb n="447" /> <cb n="CONT" /> <case>acc.</case> only: anulum, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 258, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsas causas, quae inter se confligunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam quaeque nobilitatem, formam, opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetera et praesentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.28" n="4" level="3"> (<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>) <hi rend="ital">To demand, ask, solicit, entreat, beg earnestly, to seek to gain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum a me peteret et summe contenderet, ut suum propinquum defenderem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 24, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundius a te, si quae magna res mihi petenda esset, contenderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:36:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 36, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 7, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a magistris de proferendo die,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 30, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 5, § 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid contra aequitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 20, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni opere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno opere, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinaciter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.29" n="5" level="3"> (<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>) <hi rend="ital">To assert, affirm earnestly, to maintain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contend energetically.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10770.30" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ego hoc contendo, me tibi ipsi adversario cujuscumque tribus rationem poposceris redditurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:50:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 50, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 7, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud eos contendit falsa esse delata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud pro me majoribusque meis contendere ausim, nihil nos ... scientes fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 5</bibl></cit>; Quint. prooem. § 11; 1, 2, 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1343</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 44, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:855" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 855</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 37 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10770.31" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">si manantia corpuscula iter claudunt, ut Asclepiades contendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, praef. § 28.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">contentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10770.32" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">stretched, strained, tense, tight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui jam contento, jam laxo fune laborat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 325</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contentis oculis prosequi aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentis corporibus facilius feruntur onera (opp. remissa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contentā cervice trahunt plaustra (boves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Placideiani contento poplite miror Proelia,</quote> <trans><tr>with the knee stiffly bent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.33" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">eager, intent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contenta mens fuit in eā ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:965" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 965</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 515</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et contentā voce atrociter dicere et summissā leniter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:17:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 17, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tribunatum contento studio cursuque veniamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentissimā voce clamitans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 147</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tentē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">earnestly, with great exertion, vehemently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro se dicere ... mittere contentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">acriter atque contente pro suis decretis propugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentissime clamitare, App. Flor. n. 8: contentius ambulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamentis iisdem uti fere licebit, alias contentius, alias summissius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid curiose atque contente lectitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contenebrasco: <entryFree id="n10771" type="hapax" key="conte^ne_^brasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĕnē^brasco</orth>, <itype>brāvi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [tenebrae; cf. vesperasco], <hi rend="ital">to become</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grow very dark</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contenebresco: <entryFree id="n10772" type="main" key="conte^ne_^bresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĕnē^bresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [tenebrae], <hi rend="ital">to grow dark</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 13, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contenebro: <entryFree id="n10773" type="main" key="conte^ne_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĕnē^bro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make very dark, to darken</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jejun. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contente: <entryFree id="n10774" type="main" key="contente_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. contendo, <sense id="n10774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10775" type="main" key="contente_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. contineo, <sense id="n10775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
contentio: <entryFree id="n10776" type="main" key="contenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contentĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contendo</etym> (acc. to contendo, II.), <sense id="n10776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eager stretching, a straining, exertion</hi> of the powers of body or mind, <hi rend="ital">tension, effort, a vigorous struggling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">striving for something, a struggle after</hi> (very freq. and in good prose). </sense><sense id="n10776.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10776.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">contentio et summissio vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 261</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis aut lateris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:137 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 13, 85, § 137 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitatis et ponderum,</quote> <trans><tr>of gravitation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:45:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 45, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi (opp. relaxatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 5, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 6, 12</bibl> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of the object: <cit><quote lang="la">disputationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorum (with ambitio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">palmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis dignitatisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6, 11 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10776.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10776.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Labored, formal speech</hi> (opp. talk, conversation): quoniam magna vis orationis est, eaque duplex, altera contentionis, altera sermonis; <cit><quote lang="la">contentio disceptationibus tribuatur judiciorum ... sermo in circulis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37, 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 14, 48</bibl> Heine ad loc.; cf.: sermo est oratio remissa et finitima cottidianae<cb n="CONT" />  locutioni; <cit><quote lang="la">contentio est oratio acris, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 13, 23</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10776.5" n="2" level="3"> Gregum = admissura, <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10776.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10776.7" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to contendo, II. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">A contest, contention, strife</hi> (with weapons or words), <hi rend="ital">a fight, dispute, controversy</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">contentiones proeliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magna belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:27:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 27, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentiones, quae cum inimicissimis fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 38, 137</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:11:25 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 11, 25 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:132" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:12 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 12 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus procuratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter aliquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 21, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter aliquos de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 132</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">contentionis cupidiores quam veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10776.8" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to contendo, II. B. 3.) <hi rend="ital">A comparison, contrast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si contentio quaedam et comparatio fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 43, 152</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:12:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 12, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam hominum ipsorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:39:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 39, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 22, 51</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10776.9" n="2" level="3"> T. t. </sense><sense id="n10776.10" n="a" level="4"> In rhetoric, <hi rend="ital">a contrasting of one thought with another, antithesis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 15, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 203</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:2" default="NO">9, 2, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10776.11" n="b" level="4"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">comparison</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=75" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 75</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
contentiose: <entryFree id="n10777" type="main" key="contenti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contentĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. contentiosus <sense id="n10777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
contentiosus: <entryFree id="n10778" type="main" key="contenti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contentĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contentio</etym>, <sense id="n10778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to contention, contentious, disputatious, headstrong, obstinate, pertinacious</hi> (mostly post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">contentiosa et pugnax oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurisdictio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid contentiosius, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 174" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernicies,</quote> <trans><tr>obstinate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 202, 23</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tentĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">pertinaciously, obstinately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Jovin. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 18:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 18, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 20, 1.</sense></entryFree>
contentus: <entryFree id="n10779" type="main" key="contentus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stretched, strained, exerted;</hi> v. <itype>contendo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10780" type="main" key="contentus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contented, content;</hi> v. <itype>contineo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></sense></entryFree>
conterebro: <entryFree id="n10781" type="main" key="conte^re_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĕrē^bro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to pierce</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bore through</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conterebromius: <entryFree id="n10782" type="main" key="Conte^re^bro^mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Contĕrĕbrŏmĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>conteroBromius</etym>, a humorously-coined epithet for <sense id="n10782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Libya, which Bacchus traversed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">where much wine is pressed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 1, 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contermino: <entryFree id="n10783" type="main" key="contermi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contermĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>conterminus</etym>: alicui, <sense id="n10783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be a borderer, to border upon;</hi> perh. only <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23, 6, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conterminum: <entryFree id="n10784" type="main" key="contermi^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contermĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. conterminus.</entryFree>
conterminus: <entryFree id="n10785" type="main" key="contermi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-termĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., bordering upon, neighboring, having a common border</hi> (not ante-Aug.; perh. first used by Ovid). </sense><sense id="n10785.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n10785.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10785.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morus fonti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 774</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 315</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabula ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:553" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus tiliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:621" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aethiopia Aegypto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 14, 28, § 90</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10785.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locos jugi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 178, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl>, p. 180, 16: <cit><quote lang="la">aesculus aedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:510" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 510</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10785.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum lacu aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 150, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10785.6" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10785.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10785.8" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contermĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a neighboring region, a confine, border</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contermino Arabiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in longinqua et contermina Scythiae fugam maturavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10785.9" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contermĭ-nus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a neighbor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10785.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus morti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:702" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 702</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conternans: <entryFree id="n10786" type="main" key="conternans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conternans</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. conterno <sense id="n10786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
conternatio: <entryFree id="n10787" type="main" key="conterna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conternātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conterno</etym>, <sense id="n10787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a placing of three things together</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Lim. p. 191" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Lim. p. 191</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
conterno: <entryFree id="n10788" type="main" key="conterno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-terno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>terni</etym>, <sense id="n10788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put three things together, to make threefold</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Lim. p. 191" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Lim. p. 191</bibl> Goes.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">conternans</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">three years old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitula conternans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 5, 15, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contero: <entryFree id="n10789" type="main" key="conte^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĕro</orth>, <itype>trīvi</itype> (rarely conterui, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 212, 12</bibl>; Ven. Fort. C. 6, 4, 33), trītum, 3, <sense id="n10789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to grind, bruise, pound, to crumble, separate into small pieces</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10789.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (so freq. in medic. lang.): <cit><quote lang="la">medium scillae cum aquā ad mellis crassitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua cervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrendis infamia pabula sucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicem aridam in pulverem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 70, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fracta, contrita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 697</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. and class. in prose and poetry, </sense><sense id="n10789.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to diminish by <cb n="CONT" /> rubbing, to waste, destroy</hi> (cf.: conficio, consumo, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to rub off, wear out</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10789.3" n="A" level="2"> Of material objects: <cit><quote lang="la">latera tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves et vires agricolarum (followed by conficere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1161</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conteritur ferrum, silices tenuantur ab usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 91</bibl></cit>: superbiter contemptim conterit legiones, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 516, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">humorously imitated: ne nos tam contemptim conteras,</quote> <trans><tr>treat contemptuously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">conteris Tu tuā me oratione, mulier,</quote> <trans><tr>you wear me out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 65</bibl></cit> (cf. B. 1. b. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">corpora ipsa ac manus silvis ac paludibus emuniendis inter verbera ac contumelias conterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heri in tergo meo Tris facile corios contrivisti bubulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Viam Sacram,</quote> <trans><tr>to tread upon frequently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 23, 15: <foreign lang="greek">*paidei/an *ku/rou</foreign> legendo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to wear out with reading</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 25, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellectilem pluribus et diversis officiis,</quote> <trans><tr>to wear out by use</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquas indigno quaestu, i. e. prostituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tero.—Prov.: is vel Herculi conterere quaestum possiet,</quote> <trans><tr>squander the greatest possible fortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 68</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n10789.4" n="B" level="2"> Of immaterial objects. </sense><sense id="n10789.5" n="1" level="3"> Most freq. (like the simple verb) of time, <hi rend="ital">to waste, consume, spend, pass, employ</hi>, in a good and bad sense (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 1</bibl> Kritz); constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case> or the <case>abl.</case> only, with <hi rend="ital">dum</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10789.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem in pistrino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam atque aetatem meam in quaerendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem in litibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne otiosum tempus in studiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem in eā arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:46" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10789.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum hunc diem cursando atque ambulando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorem aevi partem somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1047" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1047</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora spectaculis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diei brevitatem conviviis, longitudinem noctis stupris et flagitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum otium socordiā atque desidiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10789.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrivi diem, Dum asto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10789.9" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10789.10" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to the person: <cit><quote lang="la">se, ut Plato, in musicis, geometriā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in medial form: cum in causis et in negotiis et in foro conteramur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 249</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 5, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10789.11" n="2" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">operam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">operam frustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sunt horum temporum,</quote> <trans><tr>to exhaust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10789.12" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus omnis gravissimas injurias quasi voluntariā oblivione,</quote> <trans><tr>to obliterate from the memory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: quam (dignitatem virtutis) reliquā ex collatione, facile est conterere atque contemnere, <hi rend="ital">to tread under foot by comparison</hi> (opp. in caelum efferre), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:30:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 30, 85</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">contrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., worn out, trite, common</hi> (mostly in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">proverbium vetustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta (connected with communia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contritum et contemptum praemium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:40:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 40, 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conterraneus: <entryFree id="n10790" type="hapax" key="conterra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-terrānĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>terra</etym>, <sense id="n10790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-countryman</hi> (castrense verbum), Plin. praef. § 1 (Codd. Barb. concerraneum = congerronem, which is perh. better; cf. Sillig ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
conterreo: <entryFree id="n10791" type="main" key="conterre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-terrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <sense id="n10791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to terrify greatly, to frighten</hi> (not freq. before the Aug. per.; esp. freq. in Livy); constr. with <case>abl.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10791.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: pectora vulgi metu, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 623</bibl>: loquacitatem nostram vultu ipso aspectuque, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 214</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 597</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervum subito vocibus venantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrox ingenium eo facto (opp. accendere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 11, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animos eā re (opp. irritare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos seditioso clamore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 39, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrocitate poenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10791.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui praeter Nioben unam conterruit omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolitos ejus tumultus equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">major solito apparatus praecipue conterruit Campanos, ne ab obsidione Capuae bellum ejus anni Romani inciperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">49 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
conterrito: <entryFree id="n10792" type="main" key="conterri^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conterrĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>conterreo</etym>, <sense id="n10792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to frighten much</hi> or <hi rend="ital">greatly</hi>, Coripp. 2, Joann. 54; 88.</sense></entryFree>
conterritus: <entryFree id="n10793" type="main" key="conterri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conterrĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of conterreo.</entryFree>
contesseratio: <entryFree id="n10794" type="hapax" key="contesse^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contessĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contessero</etym>, <sense id="n10794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the contracting of friendship</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haeret. 20</bibl>. <pb n="448" /> <cb n="CONT" /></sense></entryFree>
contessero: <entryFree id="n10795" type="main" key="contesse^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tessĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>tessera</etym>, <sense id="n10795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to contract friendsnip by means of the</hi> tesserae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haeret. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contestatio: <entryFree id="n10796" type="main" key="contesta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contestātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contestor</etym>. <sense id="n10796.0" n="I" level="1"> A jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">an attesting, proving by witness, testimony</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suprema testamenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:20:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 1, 20, § 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum (testamentum) compositum a mentis contestatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:12:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: litis, <hi rend="ital">a formal entering of a suit in law, by calling witnesses</hi>, Gai inst. 3, 180 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:40:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 3, 40, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:22:section=5" default="NO">24, 3, 22, § 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 9</bibl>: de litis contestatione.—</sense><sense id="n10796.1" n="B" level="2"> Out of the circle of judicial proceedings, <hi rend="ital">attestation, conclusive proof</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tam miserā atque maestā publicae injuriae contestatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10796.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An earnest entreaty</hi>: petivit tamen a me pater maximā contestatione, ut, etc., * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Corn. 1</bibl> Fragm. 5 B. and K.</sense></entryFree>
contestatiuncula: <entryFree id="n10797" type="hapax" key="contesta_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contestātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contestatio</etym>, <sense id="n10797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short speech</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contestatus: <entryFree id="n10798" type="main" key="contesta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contestātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. contestor.</entryFree>
contestificans: <entryFree id="n10799" type="hapax" key="contesti^fi^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-testĭfĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [testificor], <sense id="n10799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">attesting at the same time</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Testim. Anim. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contestor: <entryFree id="n10800" type="main" key="contestor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-testor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">call to witness</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10800.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n10800.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">deos hominesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:29:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 29, § 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum noctemque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 40, 102</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n10800.3" n="(b)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: contestari, <hi rend="ital">to be called to witness</hi>, P. Aufidius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n10800.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., jurid. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">litem,</quote> <trans><tr>to introduce a lawsuit by calling witnesses, to bring an action, to set on foot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:18:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 18, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 9 al.</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=57:18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 57, 18</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n10800.5" n="(b)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: lis contestatur, Lex Gall. Cisalp. 1, 48; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:26:section=5 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 4, 26, § 5 al.</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lite contestata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lis contestata cum Flavio damni injuriā esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 22</bibl> et saep.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n10800.6" n="(g)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contestātō</orth>, <itype>adverbially</itype>, <hi rend="ital">by aid of witnesses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:3:1 al" default="NO">25, 3, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10800.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: contestatus, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">proved by witness, tried</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hac perenni contestataque virtute majorum,</quote> <trans><tr>proved</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 11, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contexo: <entryFree id="n10801" type="main" key="contexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-texo</orth>, <itype>xŭi, xtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n10801.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to weave, entwine, braid, join together; to interweave, unite, connect</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10801.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10801.2" n="1" level="3"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut earum (ovium) villis confectis atque contextis homines vestiantur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alba lilia amarantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: haec directā materiā injecta contexebantur, <hi rend="ital">these</hi> (<hi rend="ital">beams</hi>) <hi rend="ital">were held together by timbers laid in a straight direction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 23, 4</bibl> (cf. Jahn, Neue Jahrb. 1855, p. 516 sq.): <cit><quote lang="la">fossam loricamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tam contextae cum sint (animae cum corporibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 695</bibl></cit>.—With <case>dat.</case> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">optime epilogum defensioni contexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 7</bibl></cit> (3), 20, 7: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleribus scelera contexens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10801.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est aetas hominis, nisi memoria rerum veterum cum superiorum aetate contexitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 34, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuncte nostra cum reliquis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema cum primis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his et plasticen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 43, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, prooem. 7; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 1, 6: in verbis singulis et contextis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:23 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 23 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius hoc carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>to weave on, continue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 8, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">interrupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris nostri commentarios rerum gestarum Galliae, Auct. B. G. 8, prooem.: quae statim referri non poterant, contexuntur postero die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10801.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to join together, to compose, make, construct, form, put together</hi> (cf.: compono, conecto, consero, etc.). </sense><sense id="n10801.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum trabibus acernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppes tenui cannā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:108" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saccum tenui vimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10801.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">librum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <trans><tr>to devise, contrive, invent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 6, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10801.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: contexere de aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to treat of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de sili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 18, § 36</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">contextus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., cohering, connected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contexta condensaque corpora (opp. diffusa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio alia vincta atque contexta, soluta alia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: tropos ille (corresp. with continua <foreign lang="greek">metafora/</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 46</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contex-tē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">connected together, in close connection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia necesse est colligatione naturali conserte contexteque fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:14:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 14, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contextim: <entryFree id="n10802" type="main" key="contextim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contextim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contexo</etym>, <sense id="n10802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a connected<cb n="CONT" />  manner, connectedly</hi> (very rare): luto nidificantes paene contextim, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 112:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 112, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contextio: <entryFree id="n10803" type="main" key="contexti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contextĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contexo</etym> (postclass.). <sense id="n10803.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A joining, putting together</hi> (opp. resolutio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 5, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10803.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A preparing, composing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis, Aus. prooem. Per. lliad: libri, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 2: narrationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contextor: <entryFree id="n10804" type="hapax" key="contextor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contextor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who puts a writing together, a composer, author</hi>: codicis, Cod. Th. 1, 1, 6, § 2.</sense></entryFree>
contextus: <entryFree id="n10805" type="main" key="contextus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contextus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from contexo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10806" type="main" key="contextus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contextus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contexo</etym>, <sense id="n10806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">putting together, a connection</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. signif., and in Quint.). </sense><sense id="n10806.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: corporum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 243</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificiorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the building of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Per. Odyss. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10806.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">connection, coherence</hi> (very freq. in Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">mirabilis est apud illos (sc. Stoicos) contextus rerum: respondent extrema primis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in toto quasi contextu orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:23:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 23, 82</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum ac verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:24" default="NO">11, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per partes dissolvitur, quod contextu nocet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:55" default="NO">9, 4, 55</bibl>. historia non tam finitos numeros quam orbem quendam contextumque desiderat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 129</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Ernest. Lex. Techn. p. 90: litterarum,</quote> <trans><tr>the succession of the letters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:24 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 24 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in contextu operis,</quote> <trans><tr>in the course</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contheroleta: <entryFree id="n10807" type="hapax" key="conthe_ro^le^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-thērŏlĕta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vox hybr., <foreign lang="greek">qhrole/ths</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n10807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-destroyer of wild beasts</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conticeo: <entryFree id="n10808" type="main" key="conti^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĭcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>a strengthened form for taceo</etym>, <sense id="n10808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be silent, be still</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:98" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 64</bibl>; cf.: conticeo, <foreign lang="greek">siwpw=</foreign>, Gloss. Lab.; v. also conticesco.</sense></entryFree>
conticesco: <entryFree id="n10809" type="main" key="conti^cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭcesco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭcisco</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 5, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>), tĭcŭi, 3, <sense id="n10809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch., to become still, to cease speaking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sounding</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10809.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed conticiscam: nam audio aperiri foris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 5, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quod ille quidem conticescit, sed sermonem suscipit Polus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hos casus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in such cases</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscientiā convictus repente conticuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: consedit ille; <cit><quote lang="la">conticui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conticuere omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 293</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 430</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10809.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To keep silence, not to speak</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper alter, alterius conspectu, conticuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30, 2</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum nefas conticuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:302" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 302</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10809.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam de vobis (hominum) gratissimus sermo conticescet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ulla umquam aetas de tuis laudibus conticescet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Marc. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: conticuit lyra, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:80" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conticuere undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 574</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10809.4" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become still</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quiet, come to rest, cease, decline, stop, abate</hi> (syn. obmutesco): <cit><quote lang="la">cum obmutuisset senatus, judicia conticuissent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tum conticisceret illa lamentatio et gemitus urbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Red. Sen. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 10, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:94:324" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 94, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae forenses et senatoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actiones tribuniciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 55, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:55:8" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 55, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 29, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conticinium: <entryFree id="n10810" type="main" key="conti^ci^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭcĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>conticesco, the time when all becomes still; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 7</bibl>, and 7, § 79 Müll.; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭcĭum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 3, 12</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n10810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first part of the night, the evening</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 95</bibl> (quoted in Varr. l. l.); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 2, 268</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conticisco: <entryFree id="n10811" type="main" key="conti^cisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭcisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. conticesco.</entryFree>
contifices: <entryFree id="n10812" type="gloss" key="conti^fi^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭfĭces</orth>, <sense id="n10812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spearmen</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">para/boloi</foreign>, Gloss. Vet. [contus-facio].</sense></entryFree>
contiger: <entryFree id="n10813" type="hapax" key="conti^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contus-gero</etym>, <sense id="n10813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spear-bearer, a lancer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 20, 188</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contignatio: <entryFree id="n10814" type="main" key="contigna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contignātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contigno, a joining together of beams; hence, concrete</etym>, <sense id="n10814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a floor composed of joists and boards; a story, floor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 62, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 9, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
contigno: <entryFree id="n10815" type="main" key="contigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tigno</orth>, no <sense id="n10815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tignum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to join together with beams, to furnish with beams, joists</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">rafters</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 3, 2, § 7</bibl>. <cb n="CONT" /></sense></entryFree>
contignum: <entryFree id="n10816" type="gloss" key="contignum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contignum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contigno</etym>, <sense id="n10816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a structure of beams;</hi> meton., <hi rend="ital">a piece of flesh with seven ribs</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=65:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 65, 7</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
contigue: <entryFree id="n10817" type="main" key="conti^gu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭgŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. contiguus <sense id="n10817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
contiguus: <entryFree id="n10818" type="main" key="conti^gu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭgŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contingo</etym> (not ante-Aug.). <sense id="n10818.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (lit. touching; hence), <hi rend="ital">bordering upon, neighboring, contiguous, near; absol.</hi> or with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Pyramus et Thisbe) contiguas tenuere domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cappadoces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna montibus (opp. admota caelo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perit Valens quinquagesimo anno contiguus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 410</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n10818.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass., that may be touched, within reach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ubi contiguum missae fore credidit hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 457</bibl></cit> (intra jactum teli, Serv.).—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭgŭē</orth> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">closely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequi aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>upon his heels</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 909</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
continens: <entryFree id="n10819" type="main" key="conti^nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. <itype>contineo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, 1.</entryFree>
continenter: <entryFree id="n10820" type="main" key="conti^nenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>contineo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, 1. <sense id="n10820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
continentia: <entryFree id="n10821" type="main" key="conti^nenti^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contineo</etym>. <sense id="n10821.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A holding back, repressing</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n10821.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(crepitūs ventris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10821.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to contineo, I. B. 2. b., and continens, B.), <hi rend="ital">a briding, restraining of one's passions and desires, abstemiousness, continence, temperance, moderation</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e)gkra/teia</foreign> (the common signif.; most freq. in Cic.; it is diff. from abstinentia, v. in h. v.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. libido): continentia est, per quam cupiditas consilii gubernatione regitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:164" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 24, 86</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:121" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferte hujus libidines cum illius continentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:52:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 52, § 115</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi pro continentiā et aequitate libido atque superbia invasere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">connected with modestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:15 al" default="NO">3, 7, 15 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10821.3" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to contineo, I. B. 3., and continens, C.) <hi rend="ital">The contents of a work</hi> (only late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">operis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 12, § 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 5, 20 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 23, 11</bibl>; so the title of the work of Fulgentius: De Expositione Vergilianae Continentiae, etc.— * </sense><sense id="n10821.4" n="III" level="1"> (Acc. to contineo, II., and continens, A. 1.) <hi rend="ital">Contiguity, proximity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regionum (just before: cohaerentia regionum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 15, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10822" type="main" key="conti^nenti^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>contineo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
contineo: <entryFree id="n10823" type="main" key="conti^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>tĭnŭi, tentum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>teneo</etym>. <sense id="n10823.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep together</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10823.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rare). </sense><sense id="n10823.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">coërceo, conjungo): contine quaeso caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod omnem continet amplexu terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 319</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mundus omnia conplexu suo coërcet et continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:22:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.
