D. 2, 22, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem levi nodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni refert primordia saepe cum quibus ... contineantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:818" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 818</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:908" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 908</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:761" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 761</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 1008: pars oppidi, mari dijuncta angusto, ponte adjungitur et continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:52:section=117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 52, § 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.3" n="b" level="4"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">to bound, limit, enclose</hi> (very rare in <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum spatium mons continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus ponto qua continet orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:147" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 147</bibl></cit>; but more freq. in <hi rend="ital">pass., to be comprised, enclosed, surrounded, encompassed, environed by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vicus altissimis montibus undique continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">undique loci naturā Helvetii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare montibus angustis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una pars Galliae Garumnā flumine, Oceano, finibus Belgarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes artes quasi cognatione quādam inter se continentur,</quote> <trans><tr>hang together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. in all periods and species of composition., </sense><sense id="n10823.5" n="B" level="2"> With partic. access. ideas. </sense><sense id="n10823.6" n="1" level="3"> With the access. idea of firmness, quiet, permanence, etc., <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep together, to keep, hold fast, preserve, retain</hi> (syn. servo). </sense><sense id="n10823.7" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(alvus) arcet et continet ... quod recepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces (opp. partiri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum (opp. dividere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arida continent odorem diutius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 18, § 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.8" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ulla res vehementius rem publicam continet quam fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 24, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Remos reliquosque Belgas in officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in officio Dumnorigem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te in exercitatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te in tuis perenuibus studiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:332" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 97, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteros in armis (plaga),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus hospitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.9" n="2" level="3"> With the access. idea of hindering, preventing motion, <hi rend="ital">to keep, keep still, detain, restrain, repress, enclose</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10823.10" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: milites <pb n="449" /> <cb n="CONT" /> sub pellibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 29</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudem sub tecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 26, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:9:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 9, 14 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nostros in castris (tempestates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 36</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">copias in castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 30</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 1; 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 17, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium quam angustissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem limine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora frenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventos carcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam in dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 261</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">se ruri,</quote> <trans><tr>to stay, remain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo se loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppido sese,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris se continere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se vallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se finibus Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 58, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenibus sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum suorum terminis se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese intra silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos intra munitionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 57</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 58: milites intra castrorum vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 34, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 24: intra castra militem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidibus provinciarum propagavit imperium, ut a peritis et assuetis socii continerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 23</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">an te auspicium commoratum est? an tempestas continet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.11" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hold back, detain, repress, hold in check, curb, check, stay, stop, tame, subdue</hi>, etc. (syn. cohibeo): <cit><quote lang="la">adpetitiones animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis cupiditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:11:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 11, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modeste insolentiam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:25:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 25, 71</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">formido mortales omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etruriam non tam armis quam judiciorum terrore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 36, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida magis metu quam fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 20, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam continet metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solo metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 7, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">animum a consuetā libidine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritatem ab omni lapsu (with cohibere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 12, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos a proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum juventus Metu deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:37 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 37 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab adsentiendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 32, 104</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se ab exemplis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperans, qui se in aliquā libidine continuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:1:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se male continet amens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male me, quin vera faterer, Continui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:729" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequeo continere quin loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: contineri, quin complectar, non queo,</quote> <trans><tr>restrain myself, refrain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 128</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vix me contineo, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam nequeo contineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vix contineor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vera audivi, taceo et contineo optime,</quote> <trans><tr>keep it to myself, conceal it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae continet, neque adhuc protulit, explicet nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:47:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 47, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 222</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.12" n="3" level="3"> With the access. idea of containing, <hi rend="ital">to comprise, contain, involve, comprehend something in itself</hi> (syn. complector): <cit><quote lang="la">(aqua gelum) quod continet in se, mittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:877" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 877</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnia, quae aluntur et crescunt, contineant in se vim caloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:2" default="NO">2, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quattuor aeternus genitalia corpora mundus Continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem militarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis innumeras paene continet medicinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 68, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(linea) centum continet (pedes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idus Martiae magnum mendum continent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucas species (vox),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tales res, quales hic liber continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:43:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 43, 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrationes, quae summam criminis contineant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula stultorum regum et populorum continet aestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">liber primus ea continebit, quae, etc., Quint. prooem. § 21: tertia epistula continebat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 28, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando ipsos loqui deceat, quartus liber continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n10823.13" n="b" level="4"> In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: contineri <hi rend="ital">aliquā re, to be contained in something, be composed of, consist of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in, to rest upon, to be supported by</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">terreno corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1085" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1085</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non venis et nervis et ossibus continentur (dii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem negabat esse ullam, nisi quae cognitis penitusque perspectis ... rebus contineretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma honestatis, quae tota quattuor his virtutibus ... continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:15:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus paucis (pedibus) continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 60</bibl></cit>: quae philosophorum libris continentur, id. prooem. § 11; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 111</bibl> et saep.: artes, quae conjecturā continentur <cb n="CONT" /> et sunt opinabiles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 23, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:1" default="NO">12, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:28" default="NO">3, 7, 28</bibl>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum, in quo omnis aequitas continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (legibus) in singulis civitatibus res publica continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 5, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.14" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to hold together in itself, to hang together</hi> (in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> very rare; but freq. as <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> cf. also the deriv. continuus): <cit><quote lang="la">per hortum utroque commeatus continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10823.15" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10823.16" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Holding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hanging together</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n10823.17" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Bordering upon, neighboring, contiguous, lying near, adjacent</hi> (syn.: junctus, adjunctus, contiguus); constr. with <hi rend="ital">dat., cum</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10823.18" n="a" level="4"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">aër mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:45:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 45, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continentia atque adjuncta praedia huic fundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mare) dissimile est proximo ei continenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 105 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cappadociae pars ea, quae cum Cilicià continens est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Morini) continentes silvas ac paludes habebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum locuples continente ripā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pars eorum, qui propiores erant continenti litori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 28, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. loca), <hi rend="ital">adjoining places, the neighborhood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cherronesum et continentia usque Atho montem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:215 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 215 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <trans><tr>the suburbs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:147" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 147</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.19" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in time, <hi rend="ital">following, next</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">continentibus diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 84</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of other abstract things: motus sensui junctus et continens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timori perpetuo ipsum malum continens fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>followed at its heels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 39, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.20" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Holding together, cohering in itself, connected, continuous, uninterrupted</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10823.21" n="a" level="4"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">continens agmen migrantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 50, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 8, 13 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; terra, <hi rend="ital">the mainland, continent</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 100</bibl> P.; Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 274, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 3, 2</bibl>; and in the same sense far more freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (rarely <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl> Zumpt, dub.; <case>abl.</case> in <hi rend="ital">e</hi> and <hi rend="ital">i</hi> equally used; <cit><quote lang="la">v. the 4th and 5th books of Caes. B. G.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 31</bibl>; 4, 36 <hi rend="ital">bis</hi> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 43, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 34, § 128</bibl>; Suet <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:65" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tib. 40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 40</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10823.22" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in time, <hi rend="ital">continual, consecutive, uninterrupted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor omnium dierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 54, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium usque ad nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber per noctem totam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 44, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febres sine intermissione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e continenti genere,</quote> <trans><tr>in continuous descent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 57, 216</bibl></cit> et saep.: ex continenti (sc. tempore), <hi rend="ital">instantly, immediately</hi>, = continuo, statim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in continenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:5:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.23" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. 2. b.) <hi rend="ital">That restrains his passions, continent, moderate, temperate</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e)gkrath/s</foreign> (rare, but in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">continentior in vitā hominum quam in pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum reges tam sint continentes, multo magis consularis esse oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epaminondas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:1:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.24" n="C" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. 3.) In rhet., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that on which something rests</hi> or <hi rend="ital">depends, the chief point, hinge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:29:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 29, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:25:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 25, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intuendum videtur, quid sit quaestio, ratio, judicatio, continens, vel ut alii vocant, firmamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 18 sqq.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnen-ter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n10823.25" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to A. 2.) </sense><sense id="n10823.26" n="a" level="4"> In space, <hi rend="ital">in unbroken succession, in a row.</hi> continenter sedetis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 37, 6</bibl>.—More freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n10823.27" n="b" level="4"> In time, <hi rend="ital">continuously, without interruption</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totā nocte ierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam amplius horis sex pugnaretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduum lapidibus pluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad ipsum negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri imagines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:39:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 39, 109</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10823.28" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to B.) <hi rend="ital">Temperately, moderately</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 106</bibl></cit>; in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 199" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Conf. 6, 12</bibl>.—Hence also, </sense><sense id="n10823.29" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B. 2. b.); medial., <hi rend="ital">satisfying one's self with, contented, satisfied, content</hi> (freq. in all periods and species of composition); constr. in gen. with the <case>abl.</case>; more rarely <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> after the Aug. per. very freq. with the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10823.30" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: his versibus, Lucil. ap. Non. <cb n="CONT" /> p. 264, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">suis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illā (sorte),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viverem uti contentus eo quod mī ipse parasset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 108</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solā Dianā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 582</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.31" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipsum audires sine comparatione, non modo contentus esses, sed melius non quaereres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:35:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 35, 134</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.32" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indagare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edidicisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:638" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retinere titulum provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:49" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes sustinuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:128" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id consequi, quod imiteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contentē</orth> (ante-and post-class., and rare), <hi rend="ital">in a restrained manner, closely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arte contenteque habere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parce contenteque vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Pan. Theod. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contingo: <entryFree id="n10824" type="main" key="contingo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tingo</orth>, <itype>tĭgi, tactum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tango</etym>, <sense id="n10824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to touch on all sides. to touch, take hold of, seize</hi> (very freq. in all periods and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n10824.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10824.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">facile cibum terrestrem rostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funem manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 239</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 151</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera Cerealia dextrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undas pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:457" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">focos ore tremente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram osculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora nati sacro medicamine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 123</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:607" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 607</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes suo igni (sol),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 407</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 408</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos sale modico,</quote> <trans><tr>to sprinkle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>: sidera comā (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> designation for a very great height), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 34</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes aërio vertice (Taurus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: summa sidera plantis, <hi rend="ital">to reach the stars</hi> (a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> designation of great prosperity), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:43" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitem taurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:860" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 860</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:423" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 423</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene terram (luna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 43, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caules (vitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextras consulum (as a friendly greeting or congratulation),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:104:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 104, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:107:4" default="NO">2, 107, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10824.3" n="B" level="2"> With partic. access. ideas. </sense><sense id="n10824.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To eat, partake of, taste</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">neque illinc Audeat esuriens dominus contingere granum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:281" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:409" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 409</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10824.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To touch impurely</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 204</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10824.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To touch</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be near, neighboring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">contiguous, to border upon, to reach, extend to;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc., dat.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">inter se;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helvi, qui fines Arvernorum contingunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turri adactā et contingente vallum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in saltu Vescino Falernum contingente agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium coloniarum Illyricum contingentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 25</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut radices montis ex utrāque parte ripae fluminis contingant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (milites) contingant inter se atque omnem munitionem expleant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 23</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10824.7" n="4" level="3"> With the idea of motion, <hi rend="ital">to reach something by moving, to attain to, reach, come to, arrive at, meet with</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>); with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">optatam metam cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ephyren pennis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines Illyricos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 568</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Creten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cadmeïda arcem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:217" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidas Phasidos undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auras,</quote> <trans><tr>to come into the air</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:416" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 416</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">avem ferro,</quote> <trans><tr>to hit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 509</bibl></cit>; cf. Ov M. 8, 351: ullum mortalem (vox mea), id. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 578</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">thus aures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 211</bibl></cit>; and aures fando, with the <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 497</bibl>: aevi florem, <hi rend="ital">to come to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reach the flower of age</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 565</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10824.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10824.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to touch, to seize upon, affect</hi> (rare). multitudo agrestium, quos in aliquā suā fortunā publica quoque contingebat cura, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contactus nullis ante cupidinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam me manifesta libido contigit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 484</bibl></cit>: animum curā. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:173" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 173</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem (curā), contacti simili sorte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:78" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 78</bibl></cit>. —Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n10824.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10824.11" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To touch with pollution, to pollute, stain, defile</hi>, etc.; so generally in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> (as a <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> the kindr. contamino was in use): <cit><quote lang="la">(Gallos) contactos eo scelere velut injectā rabie ad arma ituros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 48, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">contacta civitas rabie duorum juvenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes eā violatione templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 8, 11</bibl></cit> (for which <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 18, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefandà praedā se ipsos ac domos contaminare suas): plebs regiā praedā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 15, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi candidi et nullo mortali opere contacti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 10</bibl></cit>: dies (sc. Alliensis) religione,<pb n="450" /> <cb n="CONT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 28, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora vitiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 12</bibl></cit>.—Once <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contactus ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 714" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 714</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10824.12" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 3.) With <hi rend="ital">aliquem aliquā re</hi> or only <hi rend="ital">aliquem, to be connected with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">related to, to concern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque tam foede interemptos aut propinquitate aut amicitiā contingebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sanguine ac genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 22, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem artissimo gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum Caesarum nullo gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos (i. e. Maecenatem et Augustum) quoniam propius contingis,</quote> <trans><tr>have more ready access to the great</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinum modico usu,</quote> <trans><tr>to have little intercourse with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis in Italiā contactis gentibus Punici belli societate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si crĭmine contingantur,</quote> <trans><tr>have part in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec consultatio Romanos nihil contingit,</quote> <trans><tr>concerns not</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 22, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (causa) nihil eo facto contingitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 14, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10824.13" n="3" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 4.) <hi rend="ital">To attain to, reach, arrive at something, to come to</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quam regionem cum superavit animus naturamque sui similem contigit et agnovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10824.14" n="b" level="4"> With and without <case>dat.</case> of person; of occurrences, <hi rend="ital">to happen to one, to befall, fall to one's lot, to succeed in, obtain a thing;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">absol., to happen, fall to, turn out, come to pass</hi> (so most freq. in all perr. and species of composition; in gen., of favorable, but sometimes of indifferent, or even adverse occurrences). </sense><sense id="n10824.15" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui tam subito tot contigerint commoda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tot propter me gaudia illi contigisse laetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod isti (Crasso) contigit uni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 56, 228</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 35, 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 43, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 21, 1</bibl>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:115" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:29" default="NO">12, 11, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 3, 10</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 321</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 268</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 443</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 9</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tanto plura bene dicendi exempla supersint quam illis contigerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: quam mihi maxime hic hodie contigerit malum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 268, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (sc. servitus) potentibus populis saepe contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum miseri animi essent, quod plerisque contingeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:11:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 19, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 14, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:16:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 16, 2 al.</bibl>: quoties ipsi testatori aliquid contingit, <hi rend="ital">a misfortune befalls</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:3:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid ei humanitus contigerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:4:30" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 34, 4, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf. ib. § 2: sive in viā aliquid mihi humanitus acciderit, and v. 2. accido, II. B.).—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non cuivis homini contingit adire Corinthum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi Romae nutriri atque doceri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi recusare principatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi cognoscere (eos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:11" default="NO">1, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:25" default="NO">5, 7, 25</bibl>; 6, 1, 4 al.—And, at the same time, a <case>dat.</case> of the predicate (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quo tempore mihi fratrique meo destinari praetoribus contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximo tibi et civi et duci evadere contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4</bibl></cit>, ext. 2 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 220</bibl>, the better read. is nepotem); cf. Haase in Reisig. Lect. p. 794 sq.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo hoc oratori contingat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:290" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 84, 290</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:51 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 51 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n10824.16" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sors Tyrrhenum contigit,</quote> <trans><tr>fell upon Tyrrhenus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam palma frugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10824.17" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">hanc mi expetivi, contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis adeo id facilitate quam aliā ullā culpā meā contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si nulla contingit excusatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi quid melius contingit et unctius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 44</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia memoria atque actio naturā non arte contingant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:11 al" default="NO">2, 2, 11 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratia, quae continget ex sermone puro atque dilucido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 53</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eādem brassicā contingunt aestivi autumnalesque cauliculi,</quote> <trans><tr>arise, spring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:138 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 138 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil horum nisi in complexu loquendi serieque contingit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingere cinctutis non exaudita Cethegis Continget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:25" default="NO">5, 7, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitare invidiam, etc.... liberius in peroratione contingit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nunquam opinatus fui ... id contigit, ut salvi poteremur domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:72" default="NO">9, 3, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:39" default="NO">11, 2, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10825" type="main" key="contingo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tingo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tinguo</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to</hi> <cb n="CONT" /> <hi rend="ital">wet, moisten</hi> (perh. only in Lucr. and Verg.). </sense><sense id="n10825.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oras, pocula circum mellis liquore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:938" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 938</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina rerum colore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac parco sale,</quote> <trans><tr>to sprinkle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsum corpus amurcā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 448</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10825.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">musaeo contingens cuncta lepore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:934" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 934</bibl></cit> and 947; 4, 9 and 22.</sense></entryFree>
continuanter: <entryFree id="n10826" type="main" key="conti^nu^anter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭanter</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭātē</orth>, <sense id="n10826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. 2. continuo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, 1. and 2.</sense></entryFree>
continuatim: <entryFree id="n10827" type="main" key="conti^nu^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. continuo</etym>, <sense id="n10827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">continuously</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">sunhmme/nws, sunexw=s</foreign>, Vet. Gloss.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 112:20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 112, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
continuatio: <entryFree id="n10828" type="main" key="conti^nu^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a following of one thing after another, an unbroken series, a connection, continuation, succession</hi> (in good prose). </sense><sense id="n10828.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuatio seriesque rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuatio immutabilis ordinis sempiterni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbrium,</quote> <trans><tr>an uninterrupted succession</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: laborum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:79 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 79 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:23 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 23 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (rebus) peragendis continuatio ipsa efficacissima esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 15, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10828.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in rhet., <hi rend="ital">a period; absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:61:204" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 61, 204</bibl> and 208; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:124" default="NO">9, 4, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 261</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 13, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
continuativus: <entryFree id="n10829" type="gloss" key="conti^nu^a_tivus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭātivus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>continuo</etym>, <sense id="n10829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving to connect the discourse, copulative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 16, p. 1027</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
continue: <entryFree id="n10830" type="main" key="conti^nu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. continuus <sense id="n10830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>
continuitas: <entryFree id="n10831" type="main" key="conti^nu^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>continuus</etym>, <sense id="n10831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a connected series, continuation</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 107</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">spinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 30, 44, § 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
continuo: <entryFree id="n10832" type="main" key="conti^nu^o_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. continuus <sense id="n10832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 2.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10833" type="main" key="conti^nu^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>continuus</etym>. <sense id="n10833.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to join together in uninterrupted succession, to make continuous</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10833.1" n="A" level="2"> In space, <hi rend="ital">to join one with another, to connect, unite</hi> (class. in prose and poetry; most freq. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>); constr. with the <case>dat.</case> or (more freq.) <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10833.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aër) mari continuatus et junctus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:45:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 45, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum Alyattei Campis Mygdoniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus lateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 496</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Medial: Suionibus Sitonum gentes continuantur,</quote> <trans><tr>border upon, are next to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10833.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">binas aut amplius domos,</quote> <trans><tr>to erect in rows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundos in agro Casinati optimos et fructuosissimos,</quote> <trans><tr>to buy, acquire contiguous plots of ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit> (v. the pass. in connection); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">latissime agrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26, 70</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus, quā Palatium et Maecenatis hortos continuaverat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <trans><tr>to connect together in a period</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:37:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 37, 149</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba verbis aut nomina nominibus (just before: cadentia similiter jungere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 43</bibl></cit>.—Medial: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (atomi) cohaerescunt inter se et aliae alias adprehendentes continuantur,</quote> <trans><tr>hang together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10833.4" n="B" level="2"> Of time and objects relating to it, <hi rend="ital">to join, connect together, to continue uninterruptedly, to do successively one thing after another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassius die ac nocte continuato itinere ad eum pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntius diem noctemque itinere continuato ingentem attulit terrorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continens die ac nocte proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 22, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">perpotationem biduo duabusque noctibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem noctemque potando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">theatro dies totos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 37, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 33, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeturam ei,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to give it to him immediately after the ædileship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:91:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 91, 3</bibl></cit>: dapes. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">febrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatigatio continuati laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (libertas) usque ad hoc tempus honoribus, imperiis ... continuata permansit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 11, 25</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos ferro,</quote> <trans><tr>to slay one after another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:292" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 292</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos hastis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 745</bibl></cit>. —In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemi continuatur hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">paci externae confestim discordia domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damna damnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10833.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to continue, last</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">febres ita ut coepere continuant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 233</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:362" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 35, 87, § 362</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:35" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 5, 17, § 35</bibl>.— Hence, * </sense><sense id="n10833.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., continuously, in uninterrupted succession</hi> (opp. carptim), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 1:24" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Retract. 1, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10833.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭ-nŭātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., in uninterrupted succession</hi>, <cb n="CONT" /> <hi rend="ital">one after another</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=315:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 315, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=314:32" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 314, 32</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Diff. Verb. p. 2195" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Diff. Verb. p. 2195</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
continuor: <entryFree id="n10834" type="main" key="conti^nu^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭor</orth>, <itype>ātus, āri, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> collat. form of continuo (rare and mostly post-class.), <hi rend="ital">to unite one's self to, to join</hi>: Marius ostio Liris evehitur, adque Aenariam suos continuatur, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde me commodum egredientem continuatur Pytheas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 172, 34; 6, p. 180, 24; 11, p. 259, 26; Enar. Pan. Const. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:8:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:53" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:44" default="NO">4, 44</bibl>; cf. continuo, I. A. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> and <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
continuus: <entryFree id="n10835" type="main" key="conti^nu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contineo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n10835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">joining, connecting with something</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">hanging together</hi>, in space or time, <hi rend="ital">uninterrupted, continuous</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10835.1" n="I" level="1"> Of space (so mostly Aug. and post-Aug.; cf., however, continue); with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10835.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër continuus terrae est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: Leucada continuam veteres habuere coloni; <cit><quote lang="la">nunc freta circuëunt,</quote> <trans><tr>joined to the mainland</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis proxima quaeque et deinceps continua amplexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 6, 5</bibl>: montes, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 189</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluere continuo alveo (Euphraten),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 124</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenus uno alveo continuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqui vice dentium continuo osse gignuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia continua et paria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:51:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 51, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:517" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 517</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10835.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnŭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">he who is always about one, an attendant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cocceius Nerva, continuus principis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 26</bibl></cit> (32) Halm, Draeg. ad loc. (Nipperd. and Ritter, principi).—</sense><sense id="n10835.4" n="B" level="2"> Tron., of rhet. matters (most freq. in Quint.): cum fluxerunt plures continuae translationes (the figure derived from an uninterrupted, flowing stream; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 27, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">expositio (opp. partita),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab exordio usque ad ultimam vocem continuus quidam gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:1" default="NO">6, 4, 1</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10</bibl></cit>. 7, 14 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10835.5" n="II" level="1"> Of time and objects relating to it, <hi rend="ital">following one after another, successive, continuous</hi> (class. in all periods and species of composition): auferet ex oculis veniens Aurora Boöten;
