<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:21:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 21, § 1</bibl>.—Hence: qui contra dicunt or disputant, <hi rend="ital">the opponents</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec qui contra dicunt causam difficilem repellunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad coarguendos qui contra disputant,</quote> <trans><tr>to refule his opponents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.46" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To oppose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">object to</hi> a proposition, motion, or petition: <cit><quote lang="la">quam palam principes dixerunt contra!</quote> <trans><tr>protested against it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:16:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 16, § 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 47, 130</bibl>.—With pugnare: <cit><quote lang="la">cum decerneretur frequenti senatu, contra pugnante Pisone, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius ejus incolumitatem optat: contradicit pater,</quote> <trans><tr>the father objects</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:83" default="NO">9, 2, 83</bibl>; Plin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:16:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:33:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 33, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contradicente nullo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 3, 15</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">To reply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contradixit edicto,</quote> <trans><tr>answered by an edict</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 56</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Abl. absol. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">explorandum videtur an etiam contradicto aliquando judicio consuetudo firmata sit,</quote> <trans><tr>whether the custom has been confirmed by judgment upon a judicial contest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:34" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 3, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.47" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. neutr. pron., to object, to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">raise an objection, to reply;</hi> esp. in legal proceedings: <cit><quote lang="la">ego enim, te disputante, quid contra dicerem meditabar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut contra si quid dicere velit non audiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:10:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aiebat illum primo sane diu multa contra (i. e. dixisse), ad extremum autem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 22, 2</bibl></cit>.— Hence: quod contra dicitur, or quae contra dicuntur, <hi rend="ital">the objections</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut et id quod intenderemus confirmare, et id quod contra diceretur refellere (possemus),</quote> <trans><tr>refute the objections</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia neque reprehendi quae contra dicuntur possunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 81, 331</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:44:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 44, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 17</bibl>.—In the same sense, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: contrā <itype>dicta, ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <hi rend="ital">plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu proposita confirmamus, sive contra dicta dissolvimus,</quote> <trans><tr>or refute the objections</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, prooem. 6.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicitur contra, nullum esse testamentum,</quote> <trans><tr>the objection is made that there is no testament</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 6, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.48" n="c" level="4"> With <case>dat.</case>, written in one word (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n10857.49" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To oppose a</hi> person <hi rend="ital">by speaking</hi> against his views: <cit><quote lang="la">solitum se etiam Thraseae contradicere,</quote> <trans><tr>to oppose even Thrasea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curioni ...,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rhet. 1</bibl></cit>. —Hence of answers and replies in law: quid si filium testatoris heres ejus prohibuit? Huic contradici potest: ergo pietatis, etc., <hi rend="ital">he may be answered by this plea</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:14:section=13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 14, § 13</bibl>.—And of advisory answers opposed to one's legal views: <cit><quote lang="la">volenti mihi ream adulterii postulare eam, etc., contradictum est,</quote> <trans><tr>my views were disapproved, rejected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:11:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 11, § 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.50" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To oppose an opinion</hi>, with <case>dat.</case> of the thing: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plures tantum sententiis aliorum contradicerent,</quote> <trans><tr>opposed the opinions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.51" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To object to a motion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">petition</hi>, with <case>dat.</case> of the petitioner: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem qui damnavit optat ne is torqueatur: pater ei contradicit,</quote> <trans><tr>the father objects</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ambienti ut legibus solveretur multi contradicerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:33" default="NO">40, 12, 33</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10857.52" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> of the petition: <cit><quote lang="la">preces erant, sed quibus contradici non posset,</quote> <trans><tr>which could not be denied</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">To contest the validity of</hi> a law (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (legibus) contradici potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">To contradict</hi> an assertion (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pro certis autem habemus ... cuicunque adversarius non contradicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.53" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">quin, to object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor Samnitibus respondit ... nec contra dici quin amicitia de integro reconcilietur,</quote> <trans><tr>there was no objection to a reconciliation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n10857.54" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To one's disadvantage;</hi> mostly <hi rend="ital">predic</hi>. with <hi rend="ital">esse, unfavorable, adverse, damaging</hi> <cb n="CONT" /> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">but cf. II. B. 2.): ut eum qui responsurus est vel tacere, vel etiam invitum id quod sit contra cogat fateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum verba (legis) contra sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed experimentum contra fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>unsuccessful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 97 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi fortuna contra fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fortuna contra daret,</quote> <trans><tr>should be unfavorable</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 65</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 13</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n10857.55" n="D" level="2"> Of logical opposition, with negative force. </sense><sense id="n10857.56" n="1" level="3"> Of a direct contrast. </sense><sense id="n10857.57" n="a" level="4"> Predicatively, with esse, fieri, etc., <hi rend="ital">the contrary, the opposite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fieri totum contra manifesta docet res,</quote> <trans><tr>but experience teaches that just the contrary is true</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 686</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1088" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1088</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in stultitiā contra est,</quote> <trans><tr>with fools the reverse is true</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac quidem re vereor ne etiam contra (i. e. sit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod contra est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis non credat, etc.? Contra autem est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:4:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra fore si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:39:section=2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 34, 2, 39, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo forsitan et contra (i. e. erit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:49" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 41, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego contra puto (i. e. esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.58" n="b" level="4"> With evenire, accidere, sentire, scribere, habere, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque contra accidit: istic enim bellum est exortum, hic pax consecuta,</quote> <trans><tr>of both the contrary has happened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:2:51" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 2, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ego contra puto (sc.: faciendum esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Att. 10:8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra evenit in iis morbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 52:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 52, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 65, 65, § 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego contra sentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:15:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; Sedig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:24:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:2:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Proculus contra (sc. sentit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:1:section=14" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 35, 2, 1, § 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:25" default="NO">33, 7, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet Celsus contra scribat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:21:section=1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 2, 21, § 1</bibl></cit>: contra probatur, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=34" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 34</bibl>.—Very rarely referring to a term in the same clause: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus disparem mitioremque naturam contra interpretabatur,</quote> <trans><tr>interpreted in an opposite sense, misinterpreted, misunderstood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 86 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10857.59" n="c" level="4"> Referring to a word or phrase in the same predicate. </sense><sense id="n10857.60" n="(a)" level="5"> To an adverb, <hi rend="ital">in an opposite manner, otherwise, differently, not</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ad summam totius rei pertinet, caute an contra demonstrata res sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:81:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 81, 330</bibl></cit>: quod viriliter animoque fit, id, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">quod contra, id turpe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 27, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit sapienter usus aut contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactuca locis apricis optume autumno ponitur, mediterraneis aut frigidis contra ( = pessime),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.61" n="(b)" level="5"> To a predicative adjective, <hi rend="ital">not, the opposite, the reverse</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aliae (res) probabiles videantur aliae contra,</quote> <trans><tr>improbable</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 32, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est quod me impediat ea quae probabilia mihi videantur sequi, quae contra, improbare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:31:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 31, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.62" n="(g)" level="5"> To a verbal predicate: <cit><quote lang="la">an frater fratri exsistat heres, an contra ( = annon),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:5:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.63" n="(d)" level="5"> To a subject infinitive: <cit><quote lang="la">laudare testem vel contra pertinet ad momentum judiciorum,</quote> <trans><tr>praising or censuring a witness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) To a clause, translated by <hi rend="ital">not</hi> or by a repetition of the clause with a negative: <cit><quote lang="la">quae secundum naturam essent, ea sumenda et quādam aestimatione dignanda docebat, contraque contraria,</quote> <trans><tr>those that were not, not</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 10, 36</bibl></cit>: quod cuidam aut sapiens videor quod una non jerim, aut felix fuisse; <cit><quote lang="la">mihi contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: an credibile est, incestum cum filiā commissum? Et contra, veneficum in novercā, adulterum in luxurioso? <hi rend="ital">and incredible</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 19</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:2:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 1, 2, § 1</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) To an attributive genitive: <cit><quote lang="la">Marius cognoscere quid boni utrisque or contra esset (i. e. mali),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 88:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 88, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum de origine laudis contraque perspiciemus suo tempore (i. e. vituperationis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii a propositione accusatoris contraque loci oriuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>the accuser and the accused</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in several titles of the Digests, as Depositi vel contra, = actio depositi, vel contraria actio depositarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3</bibl></cit> tit.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:17:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 16, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:13:6" default="NO">16, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:13:7" default="NO">16, 13, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.64" n="2" level="3"> Reversing the relation of terms in the preceding sentence, <hi rend="ital">the reverse, conversely, vice versā</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10857.65" n="a" level="4"> With its own predicate: saepe ... corpus aegret, Cum tamen ex aliā laetamur parte latenti; <cit><quote lang="la">Et retro fit uti contra sit saepe vicissim, Cum miser ex animo laetatur corpore toto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 108</bibl></cit>: illa altera argumentatio, quasi retro et contra, prius sumit, etc., (<hi rend="ital">proceeding</hi>), <hi rend="ital">so to speak, backward and in inverted order</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:13:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 13, 46</bibl>: neque illud ignoro, etc.; sed non <cb n="CONT" /> idem accidit contra, <hi rend="ital">but the converse is not true</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 5</bibl>: ut vocabula verbis, verba rursus adverbiis, nomina appositis et pronominibus essent priora. Nam fit contra quoque frequenter non indecore. <hi rend="ital">for often, not inelegantly, the order is reversed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae etiam contra valent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>if the terms are reversed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:49" default="NO">9, 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:25" default="NO">8, 6, 25</bibl>; 9, 4, 72.—</sense><sense id="n10857.66" n="b" level="4"> Belonging to the same predicate: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quidque erit dicendum ita dicet, nec satura jejune, nec grandia minute, nec item contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 36, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum emtor venditori, vel contra, heres exstitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:48" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus patrium pro possessivo dicitur, vel contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:71" default="NO">5, 10, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">junguntur autem aut ex nostro et peregrino, ut biclinium, aut contra, ut epitogium et Anticato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut capras in montosis potius locis quam in herbidis (pascar), equas contra,</quote> <trans><tr>but with mares the reverse is the case</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque ille dicere melius quam praecipere, nos contra fortasse possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:42:143" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 42, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua collegi solent ex his quae faciunt ea quae faciuntur, aut contra,</quote> <trans><tr>or vice versā</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:1:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 1, 1, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:23:section=4" default="NO">48, 5, 23, § 4</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n10857.67" n="E" level="2"> In logical antithesis of clauses with a merely rhet. force, <hi rend="ital">on the contrary, on the other hand, vice versā;</hi> sometimes almost = sed or autem (freq.). </sense><sense id="n10857.68" n="1" level="3"> In independent clauses. </sense><sense id="n10857.69" n="a" level="4"> Opposing persons or parties: fortunam insanam esse ... perhibent philosophi ... Sunt autem alii philosophi qui contra Fortunam negant ullam exstare, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 23, 36</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 372 Rib.); Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego etiam quae tu sine Verre commisisti Verri crimini daturus sum ... Tu, contra, ne quae ille quidem fecit, obicies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego contra ostendo, non modo nihil fecisse Sex. Roscium, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Italiā bellum gerimus, in sede ac solo nostro ... Hannibal contra in alienā, in hostili est terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 50, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 15, 2</bibl>; 6, 7, 4; 9, 35, 4 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:31:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 31, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 14</bibl>; id. Ira, 2, 33, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:11" default="NO">8, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra mercator, navim jactantibus austris Militia est potior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:45" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:23:13" default="NO">2, 23, 13</bibl> (3, 17, 3); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 214" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 214</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with versā vice: barbarae gentes (Alexandrum) non ut hostem, sed ut parentem luxerunt ... Contra Macedones versā vice non ut civem, sed ut hostem amissum gaudebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10857.70" n="b" level="4"> Introducing a secondary or parallel opposition of thought: in loco umidiore far potius serunt quam triticum; <cit><quote lang="la">contra in aridiore hordeum potius quam far,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:1:47" default="NO">1, 1, 47</bibl>: si nihil esset quod inane vocaret, Omne foret solidum; <cit><quote lang="la">nisi contra corpora certe Essent, etc., Omne quod est spatium vacuum constaret inane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 521</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:348" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 348</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">justa omnia decora sunt, injusta contra, ut turpia, sic indecora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 27, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 136</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 93</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 21, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 2</bibl>: facilem esse rem ... si modo unum omnes sentiant; contra in dissensione nullam se salutem perspicere, Caes. B. G, 5, 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 14, 14, § 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si male rem gerere insani est, contra bene, sani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.71" n="2" level="3"> In opposition to a dependent clause: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hi miseri, sic contra illi beati quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui ego rei tantum abest ut impedimento sim, ut contra te M. Manli adhorter, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 31, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum virtus adeo neminem spe ac pollicitatione corrumpat, ut contra in se inpendere jubeat, ac, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: aut igitur negemus quidquam ratione confici, cum contra nihil sine ratione recte fieri possit, aut, etc., <hi rend="ital">whereas on the contrary</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:38:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 38, 84</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">at contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 392</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.72" n="3" level="3"> With co-ordinate conjunctions. </sense><sense id="n10857.73" n="a" level="4"> Copulative, et contra or contraque (never with ac or atque); also nec contra (rare), <hi rend="ital">and on the other hand</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10857.74" n="(a)" level="5"> With reference to a reason or conclusion, after <hi rend="ital">nam, enim, cum</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">itaque</hi>: nam et ratione uti ... omnique in re quid sit veri videre et tueri decet, contraque falli <pb n="454" /> <cb n="CONT" /> ... tam dedecet quam, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 27, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus est enim custos ... metus, contraque benevolentia fidelis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum reficiat animos varietas ipsa, contraque sit aliquanto difficilius in labore uno perseverare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:32" default="NO">3, 8, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:20" default="NO">8, 6, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque in probris maxime in promptu est, si quid tale dici potest, etc. Contraque in laudibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 51</bibl>; so with <hi rend="ital">nec</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam nec comoedia cothurnis assurgit, nec contra tragoedia socculo ingreditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.75" n="(b)" level="5"> With contrasted examples or illustrations, often after <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audivi ex majoribus natu, hoc idem fuisse in P. Scipione Nasicā, contraque patrem ejus ... nullam comitatem habuisse sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut suspitionibus credi oportere, et contra suspitionibus credi non oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:15:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 15, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:48" default="NO">5, 10, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:7" default="NO">9, 3, 7</bibl>; 9, 4, 52; 11, 1, 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:22:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 22, § 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.76" n="(g)" level="5"> With contrasted actions, assumptions, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">atque utinam qui ubique sunt propugnatores hujus imperii possent in hanc civitatem venire, et contra oppugnatores rei publicae de civitate exterminari!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 22, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domo pignori datā, et area ejus tenebitur ... et contra jus soli sequitur aedificium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equo et asinā genitos mares, hinnos antiqui vocabant: contraque mulos quos asini et equae generassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 17</bibl></cit>: ceterum potest ex lege quidem esse judicium, sed legitimum non esse, et contra ex lege non esse, sed legitimum esse, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 65, 65, § 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:183" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 15, 5, § 183</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.77" n="(d)" level="5"> After a negative clause, affirming the opposite idea, et contra or contraque, <hi rend="ital">but on the contrary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (consulatu) ego imperavi nihil, et contra patribus conscriptis et bonis omnibus parui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc vero cum ne pulsus quidem ita sim ut superare non possim, contraque a populo Romano semper sim defensus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:33:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 33, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 6, 20</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">et contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.78" n="b" level="4"> With adversative conjunctions, at contra, sed contra, contra autem, contra vero (not verum contra, nor contra tamen). </sense><sense id="n10857.79" n="(a)" level="5"> At contra (freq.), merely a strengthened contra (v. 1. supra): huc accedit uti mellis lactisque liquores Jucundo sensu linguae tractentur in ore; <cit><quote lang="la">At contra taetri absinthi natura ... foedo pertorqueat ora sapore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:366" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 366</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:235" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 235</bibl> et saep.: nos qui domi sumus, tibi beati videmur; <cit><quote lang="la">at contra nobis tu quidem ... prae nobis beatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:45:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 45, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 26, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 36, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideo siccas aiunt Aethiopiae solitudines ... At contra constat Germaniam abundare rivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:1:3:1" default="NO">1, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 100:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 100, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 28</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10857.80" n="(b)" level="5"> Sed contra, after a negative sentence (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non quo acui ingenia adulescentium nollem, sed contra ingenia obtundi nolui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 10, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 11, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma populi Romani non liberis servitutem, sed contra servientibus libertatem adferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu ne cede malis, sed contra audentior ito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 12</bibl>.—PostAug. also without a preceding negation: <cit><quote lang="la">obiisse nostro Laium scelere autumant superi inferique: sed animus contra innocens ... negat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 765" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 765</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 6:81" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 6, 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.81" n="(g)" level="5"> Contra autem (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic. only where different subjects have contrasted predicates in dependent clauses): quia pacis est insigne toga, contra autem arma tumultus atque belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:30:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 30, 73</bibl></cit>.—In later writers = contra alone: <cit><quote lang="la">sub septemtrione aedificia ... conversa ad calidas partes oportere fieri videntur. Contra autem sub impetu solis meridiani regionibus conversa ad septemtrionem ... sunt facienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:25:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 25, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:3:25" default="NO">34, 3, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.82" n="(d)" level="5"> Contra vero (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.), used for contra: contra vero quercus infinitam habet aeternitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Atqui contra, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 287, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.83" n="c" level="4"> With disjunctive conjunctions, aut contra, vel contra, seu contra, <hi rend="ital">or on the contrary, or conversely</hi> (always without change of subject). </sense><sense id="n10857.84" n="(a)" level="5"> Aut contra: <cit><quote lang="la">num aut scriptum neget, aut contra factum infitietur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:38:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 38, 133</bibl></cit>: quae (mens) aut languescit ... aut <cb n="CONT" /> contra tumescit, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si imbres defuere, aut contra abundavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 228</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.85" n="(b)" level="5"> Vel contra: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc enim quaestiones oriuntur: Injuriam fecisti, sed quia magistratus, majestatis actio est? Vel contra: Licuit ... quia magistratus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:96" default="NO">9, 4, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:56:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 56, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:6" default="NO">8, 4, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.86" n="(g)" level="5"> Seu contra: <cit><quote lang="la">seu tristis veniam, seu contra laetus amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.87" n="d" level="4"> With causal conjunctions, nam contra (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">never contra enim): falso queritur de naturā suā genus humanum quod, etc. Nam contra, reputando, neque majus aliud, neque praestabilius invenies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:23" default="NO">9, 2, 23</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n10857.88" n="4" level="3"> In late Lat., e contra (also one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēcontrā</orth>) = contra, </sense><sense id="n10857.89" n="(a)" level="5"> In the meaning, <hi rend="ital">the contrary</hi> (D. 1.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliis vero econtra videtur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.90" n="(b)" level="5"> Et econtra = et contra (E. 3. a.): <cit><quote lang="la">honestiorum provectu et econtra suppliciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 39:45" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 39, 45</bibl></cit>.—For quod contra, v. II. E. 1. c.—</sense><sense id="n10857.91" n="5" level="3"> With emphatic particles. </sense><sense id="n10857.92" n="a" level="4"> Quin contra, <hi rend="ital">nay on the contrary</hi>, opposing an affirmative sentence to a preceding negative statement (quin etiam amplifies without opposition; sed contra opposes without amplification; quin contra both opposes and amplifies); <cit><quote lang="la">not before Livy: num qui enim socordius rempublicam administrari post Calvi tribunatum ... quam? etc. Quin contra patricios aliquot damnatos ... neminem plebeium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 37, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 31, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 26, 10</bibl>; 37, 15, 3.—</sense><sense id="n10857.93" n="b" level="4"> Immo contra (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n10857.94" n="(a)" level="5"> = <hi rend="ital">no, on the contrary</hi>, refuting opinions, after questions and in the form of a dialogue: <cit><quote lang="la">existimas nunc me detrahere tibi multas voluptates? ... Immo contra, nolo tibi umquam deesse laetitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 23:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 23, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:29" default="NO">33, 7, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.95" n="(b)" level="5"> = sed contra, <hi rend="ital">but on the contrary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde ne submiseris te, immo contra fige stabilem gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Marc. 5:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Marc. 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Polyb. 15:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Polyb. 15, 2</bibl>; cf. <pos>prep.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo contra ea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 24, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. II. E. 1. b. infra.—</sense><sense id="n10857.96" n="c" level="4"> Item contra = an emphatic et contra (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam ... beate vivere alii in alio, vos in voluptate ponitis, item contra miseriam in dolore, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 86</bibl></cit>; cf. I. A. 3. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign> supra.</sense><sense id="n10857.97" n="F" level="1"> With a comparative clause introduced by ac, atque, or quam, representing a logical or moral opposition (contra atque debuit = non ita ut debuit; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:19:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 19, 70</bibl>); cf. <pos>prep.</pos>, II. C. 3. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>, and II. E. 2. infra. </sense><sense id="n10857.98" n="1" level="3"> Of logical opposition, <hi rend="ital">contrary to, different from, otherwise than;</hi> in the best prose only with <hi rend="ital">atque</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ac.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10857.99" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">item, contra atque apud nos, fieri ad Elephantinem ut neque ficus neque vites amittant folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum Jovis, contra atque ante fuerat, ad orientem convertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:24:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 24, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium suscepturos contra atque omnis Italia populusque Romanus judicavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 43, § 95</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10857.100" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ac</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque contra est ac dicitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:15:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides, omnia fere contra ac dicta sint evenisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:24:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 24, 53</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:6:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 6, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 40, 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum contra ac Deiotarus sensit victoria belli judicaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Petreius ubi videt, Catilinam, contra ac ratus erat, magnā vi tendere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.101" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ac</hi> and <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si denique aliquid non contra ac liceret factum diceretur, sed contra atque oporteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.102" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cui contra quam proposuerat aliqua cesserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:6:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:72" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 21, 24, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl> (7), 8, 6: <cit><quote lang="la">contra quam licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:107" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.103" n="2" level="3"> Of moral opposition of acts contrary to rules and principles (cf. II. 3. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign> infra); so always with <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater Aviti, generi sui, contra quam fas erat, amore capta,</quote> <trans><tr>contrary to the divine law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut senatus, contra quam ipse censuisset, ad vestitum rediret,</quote> <trans><tr>contrary to its own resolution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra quam ista causa postulasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra quam sanctum legibus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 19, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:46:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 46, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contraque faciunt quam polliceri videntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:20:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 20, 86</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n10857.104" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc., before, against, facing, towards, opposite to, contrary to</hi> (acc. to many scholars not ante-class.; cf. Hand, Turs. II. p. 108; but found <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 24</bibl> Fleck., a line omitted by Lorenz as a <cb n="CONT" /> gloss; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 13</bibl> Ritschl; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 469, 15</bibl>, or Trag. Rel. v. 476 Rib.; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 1</bibl>, and v. I. A. 1. a. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>, and I. A. 1. b. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> supra). </sense><sense id="n10857.105" n="A" level="2"> Local uses. </sense><sense id="n10857.106" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Opposite, over against, facing</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10857.107" n="a" level="4"> Of countries and places (mostly of those separated by water; <cit><quote lang="la">adversus and e regione mostly of places opposite by land): insulae natura triquetra, cujus unum latus est contra Galliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad insulam quae est contra Massiliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodios, pacatis contra insulam suam terris, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 15, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 26, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthago Italiam contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae quae contra Tauri promuntorium inopportune navigantibus objacent, Chelidoniae nominantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 30, § 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:152" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 28, 32, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 7, 7, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.108" n="b" level="4"> Of the heavenly bodies: <cit><quote lang="la">donique (luna) eum (sc. solem) contra pleno bene lumine fulsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 708</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra Volucris rostrum posita est Lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:1:8:3" default="NO">1, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 31, 31, § 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 10, 10, § 56</bibl>.—So, tertium (latus Britanniae) est contra septem triones, <hi rend="ital">opposite</hi> (<hi rend="ital">facing</hi>); hence, contra meridiem and contra ortus (instead of ad or adversus meridiem, etc.), <hi rend="ital">facing the south</hi> and <hi rend="ital">east</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 24, 24, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:22" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 2, 2, § 22</bibl>. —So of a person standing in the sunlight: <cit><quote lang="la">cum minima umbra (i. e. a sole) contra medium fiet hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 33, 76, § 327</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra mediam faciem meridies erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 33, 76, § 326</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.109" n="c" level="4"> Of opposite ends of a line. </sense><sense id="n10857.110" n="(a)" level="5"> Of the diameter of the earth: esse e regione nobis e contrariā parte terrae qui adversis vestigiis stent contra nostra vestigia, quos <foreign lang="greek">a)nti/podas</foreign> vocatis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 123</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.111" n="(b)" level="5"> Of a line drawn: <cit><quote lang="la">contra autem E littera I erit ubi secat circinationem linea,</quote> <trans><tr>opposite the point E will be the letter I</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.112" n="d" level="4"> Of buildings, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra hoc aviarium est aliud minus in quo quae mortuae sunt aves curator servare solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(statuam) quae fuerit contra Jovis Statoris aedem in vestibulo Superbi domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 6, 13, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra medium fere porticum diaeta paulum recedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 17, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.113" n="e" level="4"> Of places on the human body: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod contra stomachum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit> (4, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>); 7, 7; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 20 (13).—Of the direction of the intestines, etc.: ea ... contra medium alvum orsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10857.114" n="2" level="3"> Of actions, <hi rend="ital">opposite, towards, against, facing</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus, ad, e regione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 61</bibl></cit>). </sense><sense id="n10857.115" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis subito ... quamque Rem contra speculum ponas, apparet imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 156</bibl></cit>: Democritus ... clipeum constituit contra exortum Hyperionis, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:17:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 17, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et contra magnum potes hos (i.e. oculos) attollere solem, Nec tremis ...?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:37" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex constiterat contra pedites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:9:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 9, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:1" default="NO">9, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne contra septentrionem paveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 33, 76, § 330</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 6, 19, § 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra solem varie refulgens,</quote> <trans><tr>placed in the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:151" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 54, 75, § 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:83" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 6, 22, § 83</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">37, 7, 25, § 95: cum terrestres volucres contra aquam clangores dabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 35, 87, § 363</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:131" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 8, 39, § 131</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.116" n="b" level="4"> Dependent on verbs of motion (very rare without the idea of hostility): <cit><quote lang="la">(Dinocrates) incessit contra tribunal regis jus dicentis,</quote> <trans><tr>towards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2</bibl></cit>, praef. 1.—So trop., of actions done for a purpose: <cit><quote lang="la">lege Corneliā de sicariis tenetur qui, cum in magistratu esset, eorum quid fecerit contra hominis necem quod legibus permissum non sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.117" n="c" level="4"> Appositively, with the predicate: (elephanti) tanta narratur clementia contra minus validos, ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">if fronting weaker animals, if brought in contact with them</hi> (not to be connected with clementia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 23</bibl>.—Similarly: dum ... fidens non est contra feram, <hi rend="ital">if fronting the animal</hi> (not dependent on fidens), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 21, § 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.118" n="d" level="4"> Against an opposing action, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra vim atque impetum fluminis conversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plateae contra directos ventos erunt conformatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut contra ventum gregem pascamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:31:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 31, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 12, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 2, 2, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 16, 21, § 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra fluminum impetus aggeribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 14, 48, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capite in sole contra pilum peruncto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 4, 5, § 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:364" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 35, 88, § 364</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:352" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 352</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:29:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 29, § 4</bibl>. <pb n="455" /> <cb n="CONT" /> —<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra fortunam tenendus est cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 5:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra stimulum calces,</quote> <trans><tr>kick against the pricks</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 36, 28</bibl></cit> (al. calcitres); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 5, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.119" n="e" level="4"> Of local actions with hostile intent. </sense><sense id="n10857.120" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vis Coclitem contra omnes hostium copias tenuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium Cartejae receptum scribis: jam igitur contra hunc exercitum (sc. constitit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertimescam, credo, ne mihi non liceat contra vos in contione consistere,</quote> <trans><tr>to face you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>; Lepidus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 34, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fronte contra hostem pedum quindecim fossam fieri jussit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41</bibl></cit>; 1, 42; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tullus adversus Veientem hostem derigit suos: Albanos contra legionem Fidenatium collocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 41, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 279</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:2:13" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:2:3:17" default="NO">2, 3, 17</bibl>.—Appositively, with a local verb understood: <cit><quote lang="la">terribilis haec contra fugientes belua est, fugax contra insequentes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>if fronting, if placed opposite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 38, § 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.121" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra sunt in Italiā contra populum Romanum in Etruriae faucibus collocata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum contra hanc Romam illa altera Roma quaeretur,</quote> <trans><tr>will be as a rival against this Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:22:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 22, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui rationi contra homines barbaros atque imperitos locus fuisset, hac ne ipsum quidem sperare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cicero) plerumque contra inimicos atque obtrectatores plus vindicat sibi,</quote> <trans><tr>when fronting adversaries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.122" n="f" level="4"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10857.123" n="(a)" level="5"> Stare contra aliquem (opp. stare ab aliquo); usu. implying hostility; mostly trop., <hi rend="ital">to stand against, to be arrayed against, to face, oppose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod contra hoc exemplum nulla staret eorum ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra populi studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 34, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra civium perditorum ... dementiam a senatu et a bonorum causā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 79, 273</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">a mendacio contra veritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra cives in acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et adversi contra stetit ora juvenci,</quote> <trans><tr>opposite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 477</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 414</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec enim (ratio) sola ... stat contra fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 14, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: contra leonem etiam stetit, <hi rend="ital">fronted</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hunted</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Carac. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10857.124" n="(b)" level="5"> Contra aliquem ire: <cit><quote lang="la">aut saevos Libyae contra ire leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:16" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 16</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti contra injurias armati eatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interritus (sapiens) et contra illa (mala) ibit et inter illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 59:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 59, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: contra venire, II. B. 1. c. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> infra, and v. also II. B. 2. b. and II. B. 1. b. infra.—</sense><sense id="n10857.125" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, </sense><sense id="n10857.126" n="a" level="4"> To persons placed together for comparison: <cit><quote lang="la">C. vero Caesar, si foro tantum vacasset, non alius ex nostris contra Ciceronem nominaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:114" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">CORONATO CONTRA OMNES SCAENICOS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> p. 331</bibl></cit>, n. 4.—</sense><sense id="n10857.127" n="b" level="4"> To things compared, as if weighed against each other as to their value, strength, etc. </sense><sense id="n10857.128" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quamcunque vis rem expende, et contra aquam statue ... Si gravior est, leviorem rem ... feret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.129" n="(b)" level="5"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (i. e. generis humani) causā videtur cuncta alia genuisse natura, magnā saevā mercede contra tanta sua munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui amicus esse coepit quia expedit, placebit ei aliquod pretium contra amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ulli fortiores cives fuerunt quam qui ausi sunt eum contra tantas opes ejus ... condemnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum studium bonorum in me exstitisse, contra incredibilem contentionem clarissimi et potentissimi viri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen prorogans nostrum et memoriam extendens contra brevitatem aevi,</quote> <trans><tr>as a compensation for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 63, 63, § 154</bibl></cit>.—So esp., valere contra, <hi rend="ital">to weigh against, counterbalance, avail</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prevail against</hi>: non vereor ne meae vitae modestia parum valitura sit contra falsos rumores, Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(illa facta) pro periculo potius quam contra salutem valere debere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:35:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 35, 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 29, 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrane lucrum nil valere Pauperis ingenium?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Helv. 5, 5</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">robur habere contra: si contra unamquamlibet partem fortunae satis tibi roboris est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 13:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of counterchecks: in Cretā decem qui cosmoe vocantur, ut contra consulare imperium tribuni plebis, sic illi contra vim regiam constituti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:33:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 33, 58</bibl></cit>.—Of antidotes: <cb n="CONT" /> cimicum natura contra serpentium morsus valere dicitur, item contra venena omnia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 17, § 61</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10857.130" n="c" level="4"> Colloq., aliquid contra aurum est, <hi rend="ital">something is worth gold, is superb</hi>, both predicatively and attributively (cf.: auro contra, I. A. 2. supra): hujusce pomaria in summā Sacrā Viā ubi poma veneunt, contra aurum imago, <hi rend="ital">a spectacle for gold</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a magnificent sight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 10</bibl> MSS. (al. aliter): <cit><quote lang="la">numcubi hic vides citrum ... num quod emblema aut lithostratum? quae illic omnia contra aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>superb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit> MSS. (Schneid. omits aurum, ex conj.): <cit><quote lang="la">oneravi vinum, et tunc erat contra aurum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.131" n="d" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of replies, with aiebat, inquit, etc.; both in friendly and inimical sense; esp., contra ea, contra haec, = the <pos>adv.</pos> contra: <cit><quote lang="la">contra ea Titurius sero facturos clamitabat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra ea Verginius unum Ap. Claudium et legum expertem et, etc., aiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 57, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 45, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae contra breviter fata est vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra quod disertus Tu impie fecisti inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 53</bibl></cit> (cf.: contra ea, II. E. 1. infra).</sense><sense id="n10857.132" n="B" level="2"> Denoting hostility or disadvantage. </sense><sense id="n10857.133" n="1" level="3"> With verbs of hostile action. </sense><sense id="n10857.134" n="a" level="4"> Of physical exertion: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnavere et tertio consulatu ejus viginti (elephanti) contra pedites quingentos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium Afri contra Aegyptios primi fecere fustibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 200</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:142" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 40, 61, § 142</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n10857.135" n="b" level="4"> Referring to warfare (usu. adversus), bellum gerere (rarely for cum or adversus; but contra patriam, contra aras, etc., not cum patriā, etc.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bellum, II.
