A. 1. e.): a quo prohibitos esse vos contra Caesarem gerere bellum (opp. pro),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 8, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Ep. 129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Ep. 129</bibl>.—With bellum suscipere: <cit><quote lang="la">contra Antonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">contra patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 20, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnare contra patriam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra conjuges et liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:15:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armatum esse contra populum Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 13, 32</bibl></cit>.—With arma ferre (freq.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 21, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 28, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 609</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 269</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 1, 26</bibl>.—With arma sumere or capere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis contendere contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma alicui dare (trop.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem instruere (trop.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum instruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum ducere and adducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum contra Philippum mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:12:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves ducere contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere contra hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florem Italiae educere contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proficisci contra,</quote> <trans><tr>to march against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium ferre Rutulis contra Latinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 12, 14, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvare aliquem contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium inire contra Sequanos,</quote> <trans><tr>to take hostile measures against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10857.136" n="c" level="4"> Of legal contention (more freq. adversus, except with verbs of saying). </sense><sense id="n10857.137" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen., with agere or causam agere, <hi rend="ital">to act as counsel against a party</hi> or <hi rend="ital">his attorney</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum agerem contra hominem disertissimum nostrae civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:33:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 33, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:63:226" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 63, 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:15:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 59</bibl>.—Causam recipere or suscipere contra, <hi rend="ital">to accept a retainer against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(causam) quam receperam contra pueros Octavios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 49, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 17, 1</bibl>.—Adesse alicui contra, <hi rend="ital">to appear, act as one's counsel against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogavit me Caecilius ut adessem contra Satrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:7:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 5 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">esse contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: conquesturus venit; <cit><quote lang="la">at contra se adfuit et satisfacienti satisfecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Fragm. Amic. 14:1:89" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Fragm. Amic. 14, 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam defendere contra,</quote> <trans><tr>against the accuser</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuere contra aliquem (sc. causam),</quote> <trans><tr>to establish a case against an adversary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio competit contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:41" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querelam instituere contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:21:section=1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 2, 21, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum possessionem petere contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:23" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus obtinere contra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnare contra,</quote> <trans><tr>to struggle against the accuser</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 17, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 11, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod mihi contra illos datum est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a local advantage over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicare contra aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 20, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:55" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 2, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:14" default="NO">5, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:17:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronuntiare contra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 34, 2</bibl></cit>: dare sententiam contra,<cb n="CONT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:56:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 2, 56, § 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decernere contra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellare contra aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:5:6" default="NO">49, 5, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra sententiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 62, 32, § 2</bibl></cit>.—Sentire contra aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to have an opinion unfavorable to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur vos (cum) aliquid contra me sentire dicatis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 27, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.138" n="(b)" level="5"> Venire contra aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to appear as counsel for one's adversary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu, Saturi, qui contra hunc venis, existimas aliter?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 6, 18</bibl>.—Venire contra rem alicujus, <hi rend="ital">to give advice damaging one's interests</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra rem suam me venisse questus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.139" n="(g)" level="5"> With dicere and other verbs of saying. (<foreign lang="greek">aa</foreign>) Of a lawyer pleading against a lawyer: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse ille Mucius, quid in illā causā cum contra te diceret, attulit quod? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ille contra me pro Sex. Naevio diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 60, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 7, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 26, 102</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">causam dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:23:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 23, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam perorare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 24, 77</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">bb</foreign>) Of a lawyer's pleading against the parties: dic mihi, M. Pinari, num si contra te dixero mihi male dicturus es? Servil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 261</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 34, 138</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 14, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:35:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 35, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 57</bibl>; cf. with ellipsis of <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum alter pro Aufldiā, contra dixit alter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">gg</foreign>) Of a party against a lawyer: <cit><quote lang="la">si Gaditani contra me dicerent,</quote> <trans><tr>if the Gaditani were my adversaries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:17:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 17, 38</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">dd</foreign>) Of witnesses and experts, and the pleadings against them: <cit><quote lang="la">si decressent legationem quae contra istum diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:4:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 4, § 12</bibl></cit>: contra testes dicere (opp. a testibus or pro testibus). <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 118</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">testimonium in aliquem dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 17, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 36</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">contra juris consultos dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>against their legal opinions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:24:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 24, 69</bibl></cit>.—So of witnesses in scientific questions: <cit><quote lang="la">contra testes dicendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:16:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">ee</foreign>) Dicere or contendere aliquid contra aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to maintain a point against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum interrogamus adversarios ... quid contra nos dici possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 23, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamenne vereris ut possis hoc contra Hortensium contendere?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 25, 78</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10857.140" n="d" level="4"> Of literary adversaries, mostly with verbs of saying and writing: <cit><quote lang="la">cum scriberem contra Epicurios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra Epicurum satis superque dictum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra Brutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:8:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra Academiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:11:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 11, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 30, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra autem omnia disputatur a nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.141" n="e" level="4"> Of public and political adversaries (syn. adversus and in). </sense><sense id="n10857.142" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sentire contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnare contra bonos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:25:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 25, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra eos summā ope nitebatur nobilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 38, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:19:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 19, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">52, 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(tribuni) qui aut contra consulem, aut pro studio ejus pugnabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 32, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.143" n="(b)" level="5"> Of political speaking: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (Cato) eo ipso anno contra Serv. Galbam ad populum summā contentione dixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 20, 80</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:17:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 17, 53</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 9, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.144" n="f" level="4"> Of hostile or criminal acts in gen. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus, in): inire consilia contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum comparare contra aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:24:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationem facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid contra imperatorem moliri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:18:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dolor armasset contra sua viscera matrem,</quote> <trans><tr>against her own offspring</tr></trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 59</bibl></cit>.—Facere contra (more freq. with abstr. objects; cf. II. C. 1. f. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> infra): nunc te contra Caesarem facere summae stultitiae est, <hi rend="ital">to take parts against</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eae (res) contra nos ambae faciunt,</quote> <trans><tr>operate against us</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—With verbs of saying, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo disertus non intellegit, eum quem contra dicit laudari a se?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:3:70" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 3, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epigramma quod contra quamdam Gelliam scripsit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputare contra deos, in two signif.: contra deum licet disputare liberius,</quote> <trans><tr>to accuse, reproach a god</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 76</bibl></cit>; but: mala et impia consuetudo est contra deos disputandi, <hi rend="ital">to reason against the gods</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">against their existence</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 67, 168</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.145" n="2" level="3"> Predicatively, with esse (videri, etc.), <hi rend="ital">against, injurious to, unfavorable, prejudicial, to one's disadvantage</hi>: ut <pb n="456" /> <cb n="CONT" /> ex senatusconsulto neque cujus intersit, neque contra quem sit intellegi possit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:32:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 32, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:20:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 20, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 74, 299</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 81, 330</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 13, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:31:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 31, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentiam malis dare certe contra bonos est,</quote> <trans><tr>injurious to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res contra nos est, of unfavorable chances in a lawsuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:66:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 66, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:75" default="NO">4, 2, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:32" default="NO">5, 13, 32</bibl>.—Often, contra aliquem = quod est contra aliquem, referring to indef. pronouns or adjectives: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil contra me fecit odio mei = nihil quod esset contra me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (temporibus) aliquid contra Caesarem Pompeio suaserim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.146" n="3" level="3"> Added adverb. to the predicate, mostly referring to purpose, <hi rend="ital">with hostile intent, for the purpose of some hostile act, in order to oppose, in opposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesarine eam (provinciam) tradituri fuistis, an contra Caesarem retenturi?</quote> <trans><tr>or keep it against Cæsar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sero enim resistimus ei quem per annos decem aluimus contra nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium illud pecuniā esse temptatum non pro Cluentio, sed contra Cluentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:17:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 17, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quae facitis ejusmodi sint ut ea contra vosmet ipsos facere videamini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:36:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 36, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 3</bibl>: Curio se contra eum totum parat, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to speak against him</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 85</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ter;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 74, § 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:41" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 41</bibl>.—So with the force of a temporal clause: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem meam quam essent contra Massam Baebium experti,</quote> <trans><tr>in the suit against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.147" n="4" level="3"> Dependent on adjectives (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">contra se ipse misericors,</quote> <trans><tr>to his own injury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severissimus judex contra fures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.148" n="5" level="3"> With nouns. </sense><sense id="n10857.149" n="a" level="4"> Acc. to 1. b.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quam maximae contra Hannibalem copiae sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:12:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 12, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:76:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 76, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.150" n="b" level="4"> Acc. to 1. c. and 1. e.; so esp., oratio contra (cf.: oratio in). </sense><sense id="n10857.151" n="(a)" level="5"> Oratio contra (never in), of an address against the counsel of a party or against the prosecutor: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in omni oratione Crassus vel apud centumviros contra Scaevolam, vel contra accusatorem Brutum, cum pro Cn. Plancio diceret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 220</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato pro se contra Cassium = in oratione contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">haec perpetua defensio contra Scaevolam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem illam egregiam quam (Aeschines) in Ctesiphontem contra Demosthenem dixerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 56, 213</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.152" n="(b)" level="5"> Of an address against the party, either in judicial or political affairs: <cit><quote lang="la">unam orationem contra Gracchum reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 26, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Demosthenis) oratio contra Leptinem ... contra Aeschinem falsae legationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:31:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 31, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:18:91" default="NO">10, 18, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:169" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 11, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:44:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 44, 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 25</bibl> (24), 15; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:25" default="NO">11, 2, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.153" n="c" level="4"> Acc. to 1. f.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra patres concitatio et seditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 56</bibl></cit>.—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">contra volpium genus communibus inimicitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 76, 96, § 207</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n10857.154" n="C" level="2"> With inanimate and abstract objects. </sense><sense id="n10857.155" n="1" level="3"> Directly dependent on verbs (cf. B. 1.). </sense><sense id="n10857.156" n="a" level="4"> Of physical or moral exertion: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fulmina contra Tot paribus streperet clipeis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 567</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnandum tamquam contra morbum, sic contra senectutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra verum niti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra fortunam luctari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:15:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 10:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 78, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:99:32" default="NO">99, 32</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 110</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.157" n="b" level="4"> Of warfare (lit. and trop.): <cit><quote lang="la">bellum contra aras, focos, vitam fortunasque gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum gerimus ... contra arma verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—So of logical contradictions: <cit><quote lang="la">artificis autem est invenire in actione adversarii quae semet ipsa pugnent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.158" n="c" level="4"> Of legal contention. </sense><sense id="n10857.159" n="(a)" level="5"> Of the actions of the counsel or prosecutor: dicere, or perorare, agere contra aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to plead against, contest something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra argumenta, rumores, tabulas, quaestiones (opp. ab argumentis, etc.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 6, 9</bibl></cit> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra ratiocinationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:50:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 50, 153</bibl></cit>: contra scriptum dicere, <hi rend="ital">to contest, controvert a written law</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a document</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 47, 138</bibl>; 2, 48, 143; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:39:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 39, 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra caput dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>to plead against life</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 13, 44</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">servum in caput domini interrogare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 16, 5</bibl> and 8; 5, 46, 3): contra libertatem agere,<cb n="CONT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 12, 26</bibl>.—Pregn.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra rerum naturam, contraque consuetudinem hominum dicere (opp. contra nos dicere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.160" n="(b)" level="5"> Of judicial decisions contradicting documents, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra tabulas judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:17:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 17, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra sententiam dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:8:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 49, 8, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.161" n="(g)" level="5"> Admittere aliquem contra bona, <hi rend="ital">to admit a petition for</hi> bonorum possessio (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inmittere in bona),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:2:3:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 2, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.162" n="d" level="4"> Of antagonism in literary and ethical questions. </sense><sense id="n10857.163" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To contend that something is false</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere, disputare, disserere contra opinionem or sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 19, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:18:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 18, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 87, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:102:5" default="NO">102, 5</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in sententiam dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>in support of an opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 45</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">contra sensus dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra rhetoricen dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.164" n="(b)" level="5"> Of criticism, hostility to principles, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra Iliadem et Odysseam scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, praef. 8: <cit><quote lang="la">contra quorum disciplinam ingenium ejus exarserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:29:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 29, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.165" n="(g)" level="5"> Ethically: <cit><quote lang="la">contra voluptatem dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>that pleasure is a moral evil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra mortem loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>that death is no evil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in both senses: contra vitia, pericula, fortunam, ambitionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 100:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 100, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra fortunam gloriari,</quote> <trans><tr>that fortune has no power over him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 26:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 26, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.166" n="e" level="4"> Of public and political acts and speeches: <cit><quote lang="la">contra potentiam accusatorum dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:44:164" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 44, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra legem dicere or verba facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:15:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 15, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationem ferre contra coloniam ( = contra legem de coloniā deducendā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 51, 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 17, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 17, 24, § 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.167" n="f" level="4"> Of hostility, injury, wrongs, etc. </sense><sense id="n10857.168" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">senatusconsulto quod contra dignitatem tuam fieret,</quote> <trans><tr>directed against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra rem publicam se commovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:47:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 47, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra salutem urbis incitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitare aliquid contra salutem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: contra voluntatem or studium dicere, <hi rend="ital">to oppose one's will in a speech</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse aliquem in civitate qui contra ejus (Chrysogoni) voluntatem dicere auderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid contra aequitatem contendas, ne quid pro injuriā,</quote> <trans><tr>do not array yourself against equity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 20, 71</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis non contra Marii arma, contra Suliae proscriptionem irascitur? ( = Mario propter arma, Sullae propter proscriptionem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10857.169" n="(b)" level="5"> In partic.: facere contra aliquid (syn. adversus), <hi rend="ital">to commit an offence against, to transgress</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis ad Antonium profectus esset ... senatus existimaturum eum contra rem publicam fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 11, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 25, 95</bibl>; S. C. ap. Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 4, 7</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">contra salutem rei publicae facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:38:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 38, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra majestatem,</quote> <trans><tr>against the emperor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:4:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:18:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 18, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:32:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 32, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 70</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 34, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:32:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 32, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 14, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 6, 13</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra edictum (praetoris),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 3, 10, § 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:1:20:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 1, 20, § 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra jusjurandum ac fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 30, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 3, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:30:44" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 30, 44</bibl> (2, 32, 44).—And ironically: <cit><quote lang="la">tune contra Caesaris nutum (sc. facies)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—Rarely contra ea facere = contra facere, adverb. (cf. I. B. 8. and II. E. 1. b.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus in civitatem inferri non licet ... et qui contra ea fecerit, extra ordinem punitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 21, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 21, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.170" n="2" level="3"> Predicatively with esse (usu. <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">in violation of, in conflict with, contrary to</hi> (cf. 3. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>). </sense><sense id="n10857.171" n="(a)" level="5"> With esse expressed as the predicate: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem hominis incommodo suum augere commodum magis est contra naturam quam mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 5, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:13:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 13, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 8, 6, § 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra leges or legem est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 13, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:32:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 32, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra officium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 15, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:37:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 37, 2</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:112:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 112, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:1:section=7" default="NO">16, 3, 1, § 7</bibl>.—With ellipsis<cb n="CONT" />  of object (naturam), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:29:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 29, 89</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo res ista non habet ullam moram quae contra causas ignium sit,</quote> <trans><tr>unfavorable to the formation of fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:26:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 26, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10857.172" n="(b)" level="5"> With verbal predicate, referring to an <hi rend="ital">indef. pron.</hi> or <pos>adj.</pos>, with esse understood: <cit><quote lang="la">scis hunc ... nihil umquam contra rem tuam cogitasse ( = nihil quod contra rem tuam esset),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:50:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 50, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid contra animum audiendi,</quote> <trans><tr>something against our liking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 19:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 19, 2</bibl></cit>.—So mostly with facere: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid Socrates aut Aristippus contra morem consuetudinemque fecerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 15, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:17" default="NO">8, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:79:section=2" default="NO">35, 1, 79, § 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n10857.173" n="(g)" level="5"> Contra officium, substantively, = id quod contra officium est: <cit><quote lang="la">Sic inter recte factum atque peccatum, officium et contra officium, media locabat quaedam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 10, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.174" n="3" level="3"> Adverbially with the predicate. </sense><sense id="n10857.175" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In order to oppose, in opposition to, with hostile intent</hi> (cf. B. 3.): <cit><quote lang="la">eidem illam proscriptionem capitis mei contra salutem rei publicae rogatam esse dicebant,</quote> <trans><tr>that the proposal of the law was an attack on the republic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 19, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 12, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 10, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperator contra postulata Bocchi nuntios mittit,</quote> <trans><tr>to reply to the demands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 83:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 83, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 6</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">advocare contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Polyb. 12:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Polyb. 12, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:2:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 15, 2, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si contra mortem te praeparaveris,</quote> <trans><tr>to meet death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 11:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.176" n="(b)" level="5"> With the force of a clause of manner, <hi rend="ital">injuriously to</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus contra valetudinis commodum laborandum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 23, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra hominis salutem,</quote> <trans><tr>with danger to a man's life</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 62, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.177" n="(g)" level="5"> In gen., of conflict with some rule or principle, <hi rend="ital">contrary to, in violation of, without regard to</hi> ( = ita ut contra sit; cf. 2. supra; very freq. from the class. period; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. adversus): ceperitne pecunias contra leges P. Decius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:31:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 31, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 4, § 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 34, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam contra leges auferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:18:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 18, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 10, § 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 18, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:26:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 26, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 16, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra jus fasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 16, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 6, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Dom. 13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 13, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Verr. 2:5:13:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13, § 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra jus gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 32, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 25, 7</bibl>; 5, 36, 6; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 1, 6: contra juris rigorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:24:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 5, 24, § 10</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra testimonium aliquid judicare,</quote> <trans><tr>without regard to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 31, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid contra verecundiam disputare,</quote> <trans><tr>contrary to the rules of decency</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 35, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid contra fidem constituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae majores nostri contra lubidinem animi sui recte atque ordine fecere,</quote> <trans><tr>contrary to the dictates of passion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 33, 1</bibl>; cf. of logical opposition, II. E. 2. infra.—</sense><sense id="n10857.178" n="4" level="3"> Dependent on substt. </sense><sense id="n10857.179" n="a" level="4"> Of physical strife: <cit><quote lang="la">scit ille imparem sibi luctatum contra nexus (draconis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 12, 12, § 33</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10857.180" n="b" level="4"> Of warfare: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatorum copia contra tuum furorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 39, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parthorum gloria contra nomen Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: in castris perditorum contra patriam, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.181" n="c" level="4"> Of legal contention: <cit><quote lang="la">causa contra scriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:46:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 46, 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.182" n="d" level="4"> Of political speaking: <cit><quote lang="la">divina M. Tullii eloquentia contra leges agrarias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:50" default="NO">9, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 7, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.183" n="e" level="4"> Of literary opposition: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris vituperatio contra laudationem meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 40, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.184" n="f" level="4"> Of hostility, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus factum, inceptum, conatumve contra patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ullum factum dictumve nostrum contra utilitatem vestram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.185" n="g" level="4"> Of injury: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae cupiditas contra rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 37, 90</bibl></cit>: contra serpentes venenum, <hi rend="ital">fatal to serpents</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">as a defence against serpents</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.186" n="h" level="4"> Of violation, disregard, etc. (cf. 3. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">iter contra senatus auctoritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 19, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra consuetudinem somnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 77, 98, § 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum possessio contra tabulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:4:3:section=13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 4, 3, § 13</bibl></cit>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.187" n="5" level="3"> Dependent on adjectives (very rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">II. D. 2. c. infra): contraque patris impii regnum impotens, avum resolvam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 966" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 966</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n10857.188" n="D" level="2"> Of defence, protection, and resistance (syn.: adversus, ab). </sense><sense id="n10857.189" n="1" level="3"> Against persons. </sense><sense id="n10857.190" n="a" level="4"> Dependent on verbs: <cit><quote lang="la">cum populus Romanus suam auctoritatem vel contra omnes qui dissentiunt possit defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 63</bibl></cit>: si ego consul rem publicam <pb n="457" /> <cb n="CONT" /> contra te et gregales tuos defendissem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:52:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 52, 111</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra quem multum omnes boni providerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>provided a great defence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:38:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 38, 81</bibl></cit>: formula quā utitur patronus contra libertum qui eum in jus vocat, <hi rend="ital">as a defence against</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 46</bibl>. —And of protection of plants against injurious animals: <cit><quote lang="la">contra haec animalia proderit, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 10, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.191" n="b" level="4"> Dependent on adjectives, mostly participial: <cit><quote lang="la">paratus contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 21, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil satis firmum contra Metellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 80:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 80, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra potentes nemo est munitus satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.192" n="2" level="3"> Against inanimate and abstract things. </sense><sense id="n10857.193" n="a" level="4"> Dependent on verbs: <cit><quote lang="la">contra avium morsus munitur vallo aristarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propugnaculum, quo contra omnes meos impetus usurum se putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:16:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 16, § 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 39, § 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicam causam contra vim armatam suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:34:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 34, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra tantas difficultates providere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 90:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 90, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:76:4" default="NO" valid="yes">76, 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">contra ea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 57:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 57, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patricii vi contra vim resistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 4:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Const. 5, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.194" n="b" level="4"> Dependent on substt.: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragia contra oppugnationem vestrae majestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensio contra vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patronus justitiae fuit contra orationem Phili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 9, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 3, 4, § 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra labores patientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 22, § 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.195" n="c" level="4"> Dependent on adjectives (in Cic. freq. with <pos>P. a.</pos> predicatively used; otherwise very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">in later prose freq.): nec est quidquam Ciliciā contra Syriam munitius,</quote> <trans><tr>against an attack from the side of Syria</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nullius res tuta, nullius domus clausa, nullius vita saepta, nullius pudicitia munita contra tuam cupiditatem posset esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:15:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 15, § 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 25, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 27, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir contra audaciam firmissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 33, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortis contra dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 98:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 98, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">callosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 2, 4, § 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">far contra hiemes firmissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 8, 19, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus tenax contra vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contraque minantia fata pervigil,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> I. Cons. Stil. 1, 284</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.196" n="3" level="3"> Of remedies against sickness and its causes, poison, etc.; so only in Plin.; in Pall. only of preventives and of protection against hurtful animals, and against mental perturbations in gen.; cf. infra (syn. ad in Cat., Cic., Cels., Col.; adversus only in Celsus, who also has <hi rend="ital">in</hi> with <case>abl.</case>). </sense><sense id="n10857.197" n="(a)" level="5"> Dependent on verbs: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus et vinum et uva contra serpentium ictus medetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 18, 22, § 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2, 2, § 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodest et contra suspiria et tussim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 13, 50, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valet potum contra venena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 7, 21, § 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 22, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:81" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 26, § 81</bibl>; 28, 8, 27, § 98; 16, 37, 71, § 180; 35, 6, 14, § 34; 28, 6, 18, §§ 65-67.—</sense><sense id="n10857.198" n="(b)" level="5"> Dependent on substt.: <cit><quote lang="la">remedium contra morsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:163" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 59, 79, § 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra venena esse omnia remedio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 44, 95, § 251</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:240" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 24, 37, § 240</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 1, 1, § 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.199" n="(g)" level="5"> Dependent on adjectives: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum quod salutare contra pestilentiam sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 14, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.200" n="(d)" level="5"> Appositively, <hi rend="ital">as a remedy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus lacteum succum miris laudibus celebrat ... contra serpentes et venena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:83" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 26, § 83</bibl>. —So of remedies against affections: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberium tonante caelo coronari eā (lauro) solitum ferunt contra fulminum metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 135</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:21:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. 5</bibl>. 1.</sense><sense id="n10857.201" n="E" level="2"> Of logical opposition. </sense><sense id="n10857.202" n="1" level="3"> With a neuter demonstrative (contra ea, contra haec, contra quae, quod contra = <itype>contra</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>). </sense><sense id="n10857.203" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The contrary, the reverse</hi> (very rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">I. D. 1.): sed mihi contra ea videtur,</quote> <trans><tr>but to me the contrary seems true</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae contra haec sunt, omnia quae contra sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>and vice versa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 90</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10857.204" n="b" level="4"> Contra ea, <hi rend="ital">on the contrary</hi>, in logical antithesis (not in Cic. and Sall.; once in Caes. and Quint.; several times in Liv. and Nep.; cf.: contra ea, in other uses, II. A. 2. e. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>, II. D. 2. a., II. A. 3. d., II. C. 1. f.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes arderent cupiditate pugnandi ... contra ea Caesar ... spatiumque interponendum ... putabat ( = at contra),</quote> <trans><tr>but Cæsar on the contrary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 74</bibl></cit>: superbe ab Samnitibus ... legati prohibiti commercio sunt; <cit><quote lang="la">contra ea benigne ab Siculorum tyrannis adjuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 52, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:60:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 60, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:20" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 20</bibl>, <cb n="CONT" /> 6; <cit><quote lang="la">44, 43, 5: pater ... Thracem me genuit, contra ea mater Atheniensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphicr. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; id. praef. 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 8, 1</bibl>.—And after a question, with <hi rend="ital">immo</hi> (cf. I. E. 5. b.): <cit><quote lang="la">an infirmissimi omnium ... (sumus)? Immo contra ea vel viribus nostris, vel, etc., tuti (sumus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 24, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10857.205" n="c" level="4"> Quod contra, by anastrophe (v. F. 1.), <hi rend="ital">contrary to which, whereas, while on the contrary</hi> (only once in Lucr. and three times in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">illud in his rebus vereor ne forte rearis, Inpia te rationis inire elementa viamque indugredi sceleris: quod contra saepius illa Religio peperit scelerosa atque impia facta,</quote> <trans><tr>whereas on the contrary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus a me corpus crematum est, quod contra decuit ab illo meum (sc. cremari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod contra oportebat delicto dolere, correctione gaudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 90</bibl></cit> (B. and K. place a comma after oportebat; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Nauck ad loc.): reliquum est ut eum nemo judicio defenderit: quod contra copiosissime defensum esse contendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 28, 87</bibl></cit> (many consider contra in all these passages as an adverb; cf. Hand, Turs. II. p. 121 sq.; some explain quod as an ancient ablative, = quā re; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Ritschl,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Exc. p. 57</bibl></cit>, Munro ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 82</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n10857.206" n="2" level="3"> With an abstract noun, with the force of the adverb contra with <hi rend="ital">ac</hi> or <hi rend="ital">atque</hi> (I. F. 1.), <hi rend="ital">contrary to, contrary to what</hi>, etc. (esp. in Sall., not in Cic.; cf. praeter): celeriter contraque omnium opinionem confecto itinere, <hi rend="ital">contrary to the opinion</hi> ( = contra ac rati erant), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra opinionem Jugurthae ad Thalam perveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 75:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 75, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:40" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 40</bibl>.—Contra spem either <hi rend="ital">contrary to the opinion</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">against the hope</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metellus contra spem suam laetissume excipitur ( = contra ac ratus, veritus est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 88:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 88, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cetera contra spem salva invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 23, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra spem omnium L. Furium optavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 25, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:45" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 45</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: at Jugurtha contra spem nuntio accepto ( = contra ac speraverat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 28, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 45, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam ... Jugurtha contra timorem animi praemia sceleris adeptum sese videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse in Numidiam procedit, ubi contra belli faciem tuguria plena hominumque ... erant ( = contra ac in bello evenire solet),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 46, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra famam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 43, § 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:180" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 53, 54, § 180</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">segniterque et contra industriam absconditae formicae,</quote> <trans><tr>slowly, and in a manner different from their usual activity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 35, 88, § 364</bibl></cit>.—Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidam potionem esse debere, contra priores auctores, Asclepiades confirmavit,</quote> <trans><tr>contrary to the opinion of the former physicians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 26</bibl></cit> (19).</sense><sense id="n10857.207" n="F" level="1"> Sometimes by anastrophe after its noun. </sense><sense id="n10857.208" n="1" level="3"> In prose, after relatives, esp. in Cic.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos contra disputant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem contra dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 8, 18</bibl></cit> (v. II. B. 1. f.): <cit><quote lang="la">quem contra veneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas contra, praeter te, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos ipsos quos contra statuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos contra me senatus armavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam contra multa locutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 7</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 332</bibl>; v. also E. 1. c. supra.—</sense><sense id="n10857.209" n="2" level="3"> After other words (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">hunc igitur contra mittam contendere causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 471</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere eos contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donique eum contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 708</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum Alciden contra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paridem contra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam contra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Messania moenia contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora Calabriae contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
